He leads the MLS with nine goals and tied for the league-lead with seven assists.\n\nInter Miami is looking for its fourth consecutive win, while the Red Bulls are also on a tear losing just one of their last 10 games to reigning MLS champion Columbus Crew.\n\nYes, Messi is expected to start and play tonight against New York Red Bulls.\n\nThe match begins 7:30 p.m. ET and available for free via MLS Season Pass on Apple TV.\n\nWATCH: Messi and Inter Miami host the New York Red Bulls on Apple TV\n\nTICKETS: Experience Messi and Inter Miami in person at home against the New York Red Bulls\n\nSHOP: Get the latest Messi and Inter Miami team gear from the MLS Store\n\nMessi set a MLS record with his fifth two-or-more-goal contributions in five consecutive matches, when he scored two goals with an assist against New England last week.\n\nMessi has 16 goal contributions in his first seven MLS matches this season, which is the most in league history. The previous high was 13 in seven games by Thierry Henry (2012) and Carlos Vela (2019).\n\nIf Messi has a goal or assist against New York Red Bulls, he'll become the third player in MLS history to do so in his first eight games of a season. Cobi Jones (first nine games in 1998) and Clint Dempsey (first eight games in 2015) are the others.\n\nInter Miami enters with 21 points atop the conference, while the Red Bulls are in third with 17 {"uri": "8111766480", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "02:53:21", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T02:53:21Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T02:12:08Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8470588326454163, "url": "https://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/ap/article-13383939/Messi-scores-goal-5-assists-lead-Inter-Miami-6-2-rout-Red-Bulls.html", "title": "Messi has a record-setting game with a goal and 5 assists in Inter...", "body": "FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla. (AP) - Lionel Messi had a record setting night for Inter Miami.\n\nHe scored a goal and had five assists as Inter Miami trounced the New York Red Bulls 6-2 on Saturday night - with the Argentine great and eight-time Ballon d'Or winner as the game's best player setting no fewer than three Major League Soccer records in the effort.\n\nThe six goal contributions, five assists and five assists in a half were all MLS records.\n\nMessi, who earned the MLS Player of the Month Award for April, has now scored and assisted in six consecutive league matches.\n\nLuis Su\u00e1rez had three goals and Matias Rojas scored twice as Inter Miami got six unanswered goals to come back from a 1-0 deficit at halftime. Messi and Su\u00e1rez now have a league-leading 10 goals each, helping keep Inter Miami (7-2-3, 24 points) atop the Eastern Conference.\n\nThe win extended Miami\u00b4s unbeaten string to six. The streak began after a 4-0 loss at New York on April 20, in which Messi did not play because of an injury.\n\nInter Miami forward Lionel Messi falls on New York Red Bulls midfielder Daniel Edelman during the first half of an MLS soccer game, Saturday, May 4, 2024, in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. (AP Photo/Michael Laughlin)\n\nMiami began the rout with Rojas\u00b4 equalizer in the 48th minute. Messi centered a pass to Rojas whose left-footed shot landed under the crossbar.\n\nSu\u00e1rez then fed a charging Messi with a touch pass to beat New York goalkeeper Carlos Coronel with a shot from 15 yards.\n\nRojas made it 3-1 with his second goal in the 62nd minute on an assist from Messi.\n\nMessi then contributed on former Barcelona teammate Su\u00e1rez\u00b4s first goal in the 69th minute.\n\nSu\u00e1rez also struck in the 75th and 81st minutes before the Red Bulls (4-2-5, 17 points) closed the scoring on Emil Forsberg\u00b4s penalty kick in stoppage time.\n\nNew York controlled possession early and eventually capitalized on a Miami defensive breakdown that resulted on Dante Vanzeir\u00b4s goal in the 30th minute. Jos\u00e9 Carmona ran deep into the right wing of the large area and blasted a shot that bounced off the far post. An unmarked Vanzeir retrieved the deflection and converted from 15 yards.\n\nMessi had his only scoring opportunity of the first half in the 24th minute, when Coronel stopped his shot from the edge of the penalty area.\n\nMessi\u00b4s former Barcelona teammate Jordi Alba missed his third straight game because of a hamstring injury.\n\nBoth clubs will continue MLS play next Saturday. Inter Miami will visit CF Montreal while the Red Bulls will host New England.\n\nAP soccer: https://apnews.com/hub/soccer\n\nInter Miami forward Lionel Messi dribbles the ball during the first half of an MLS soccer game against the New York Red Bulls, Saturday, May 4, 2024, in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. {"uri": "8111792211", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "02:59:01", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T02:59:01Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T02:56:18Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8470588326454163, "url": "https://www.eagletribune.com/messi-has-a-record-setting-game-with-a-goal-and-5-assists-in-inter-miamis/article_2412d767-f590-52a3-9c6d-a8a92ba70967.html", "title": "Messi has a record-setting game with a goal and 5 assists in Inter Miami's 6-2 win over Red Bulls", "body": "Inter Miami forward Lionel Messi runs into New York Red Bulls midfielder Daniel Edelman during the first half of an MLS soccer match Saturday, May 4, 2024, in Fort Lauderdale, Fla.\n\nFORT LAUDERDALE, Fla. (AP) -- Lionel Messi had a record setting night for Inter Miami.\n\nHe scored a goal and had five assists as Inter Miami trounced the New York Red Bulls 6-2 on Saturday night -- with the Argentine great and eight-time Ballon d'Or winner as the game's best player setting no fewer than three Major League Soccer records in the effort.\n\nThe six goal contributions, five assists and five assists in a half were all MLS records.\n\nMessi, who earned the MLS Player of the Month Award for April, has now scored and assisted in six consecutive league matches.\n\nLuis Su\u00e1rez had three goals and Matias Rojas scored twice as Inter Miami got six unanswered goals to come back from a 1-0 deficit at halftime. Messi and Su\u00e1rez now have a league-leading 10 goals each, helping keep Inter Miami (7-2-3, 24 points) atop the Eastern Conference.\n\nThe win extended Miami's unbeaten string to six. The streak began after a 4-0 loss at New York on April 20, in which Messi did not play because of an injury.\n\nMiami began the rout with Rojas' equalizer in the 48th minute. Messi centered a pass to Rojas whose left-footed shot landed under the crossbar.\n\nSu\u00e1rez then fed a charging Messi with a touch pass to beat New York goalkeeper Carlos Coronel with a shot from 15 yards.\n\nRojas made it 3-1 with his second goal in the 62nd minute on an assist from Messi.\n\nMessi then contributed on former Barcelona teammate Su\u00e1rez's first goal in the 69th minute.\n\nSu\u00e1rez also struck in the 75th and 81st minutes before the Red Bulls (4-2-5, 17 points) closed the scoring on Emil Forsberg's penalty kick in stoppage time.\n\nNew York controlled possession early and eventually capitalized on a Miami defensive breakdown that resulted on Dante Vanzeir's goal in the 30th minute. Jos\u00e9 Carmona ran deep into the right wing of the large area and blasted a shot that bounced off the far post. An unmarked Vanzeir retrieved the deflection and converted from 15 yards.\n\nMessi had his only scoring opportunity of the first half in the 24th minute, when Coronel stopped his shot from the edge of the penalty area.\n\nMessi's former Barcelona teammate Jordi Alba missed his third straight game because of a hamstring injury.\n\nBoth clubs will continue MLS play next Saturday. goal and 2 assists.\n\nThe legendary duo of Luis Suarez and Lionel Messi was once again at work, as they now replaced the roles, and Suarez scored his first goal of the game, and with that, Messi {"uri": "8112286606", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "11:52:31", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T11:52:31Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T11:52:10Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8352941274642944, "url": "https://www.thehansindia.com/sports/mls-2023-24-messi-sets-assists-record-as-inter-miami-trounce-ny-red-bulls-876699", "title": "MLS 2023-24: Messi sets assists record as Inter Miami trounce NY Red Bulls", "body": "Lionel Messi set a new Major League Soccer (MLS) record of five assists in a single match as leaders Inter Miami romped to a 6-2 home win over New York Red Bulls. Luis Suarez's hat-trick was relegated to a support act as Messi, who also scored a goal, continued his outstanding run of form for the Florida outfit on Saturday.\n\nLionel Messi set a new Major League Soccer (MLS) record of five assists in a single match as leaders Inter Miami romped to a 6-2 home win over New York Red Bulls. Luis Suarez's hat-trick was relegated to a support act as Messi, who also scored a goal, continued his outstanding run of form for the Florida outfit on Saturday.\n\nNew York went ahead on the half-hour at Chase stadium through Dante Vanzeir, who thumped home a first-time effort after Wikelman Carmon's shot cannoned off the far post.\n\nMatias Rojas put Inter Miami on level terms by receiving Messi's pass before curling a 20-yard effort into the top-right corner, reports Xinhua.\n\nRojas and Suarez then linked up before the latter's deft pass released Messi, who gave his side the lead by firing home from 12 yards.\n\nInter Miami extended their advantage just after the hour through the impressive Rojas, who ran onto Messi's sublime through ball and sent a delightful chip over the head of goalkeeper Carlos Coronel.\n\nThe almost telepathic understanding between Messi and Suarez was on display as the Uruguayan striker sent an acrobatic volley into the far corner after the Inter Miami captain's lofted cross.\n\nThe former Barcelona teammates were irrepressible, and they again exchanged a series of slick passes before Suarez stroked home his side's fifth goal.\n\nSuarez, who joined Inter Miami on a free transfer in January, added to New York's misery by running onto Messi's pass and rounding Coronel before threading home his third goal from the tightest of angles.\n\nThe visitors grabbed a late consolation goal when Emil Forsberg converted from the spot after Marcelo Weigandt's mistimed challenge on John Tolkin.\n\nThe result leaves Inter Miami three points clear of second-placed Cincinnati in the Eastern Conference standings while New York Red Bulls remain fourth with 17 points.\n\nMessi has now scored 12 goals and provided 11 assists in 11 games for Inter Miami this season while Suarez has 12 goals and seven assists in 15 outings.\n\nInter Miami manager Gerardo Martino hailed the attacking partnership of Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez in the team's 6-2 home rout of New York Red Bulls on Saturday.\n\n\"Messi always makes the difference,\" Martino told a news conference after the match at Chase Stadium in Fort Lauderdale. \"Today the partnership between him and Luis in the second half worked very well, like in old times. They really were very influential in the game.\"\n\nThe other player to impress for Inter Miami was Paraguayan midfielder Matias Rojas, who scored twice and also showed a remarkable understanding with Messi. \"The truth is that everyone had a phenomenal impact in the game, but Leo probably did something historic with five assists and a goal,\" Martino said.\n\n\"I always say the same thing: it is redundant to talk about him [Messi] because it seems like he always does something new. If something was missing it was this: having an impact on the six goals that a team scores. It's going to be difficult to see something like this again.\"\n\nDespite the emphatic nature of the win, Martino said his team had plenty of scope for improvement. \"I think that in the first half, we couldn't find the passes between the lines,\" he said. \"We couldn't advance on the outside either because of the way they were set up. We knew we had to take some more risks and move the ball with more authority, which we did in the second half,\" the Argentine coach added.", "source": {"uri": "thehansindia.com", "dataType": "news", {"uri": "2024-05-345471986", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "09:58:10", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T09:58:10Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T02:19:09Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8352941274642944, "url": "https://www.sudbury.com/national-sports/messi-has-a-record-setting-game-with-a-goal-and-5-assists-in-inter-miamis-6-2-win-over-red-bulls-8699434", "title": "Messi has a record-setting game with a goal and 5 assists in Inter Miami's 6-2 win over Red Bulls", "body": "FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla. (AP) -- Lionel Messi had a record setting night for Inter Miami.\n\nHe scored a goal and had five assists as Inter Miami trounced the New York Red Bulls 6-2 on Saturday night -- with the Argentine great and eight-time Ballon d'Or winner as the game's best player setting no fewer than three Major League Soccer records in the effort.\n\nThe six goal contributions, five assists and five assists in a half were all MLS records.\n\nMessi, who earned the MLS Player of the Month Award for April, has now scored and assisted in six consecutive league matches.\n\nLuis Su\u00e1rez had three goals and Matias Rojas scored twice as Inter Miami got six unanswered goals to come back from a 1-0 deficit at halftime. Messi and Su\u00e1rez now have a league-leading 10 goals each, helping keep Inter Miami (7-2-3, 24 points) atop the Eastern Conference.\n\nThe win extended Miami's unbeaten string to six. The streak began after a 4-0 loss at New York on April 20, in which Messi did not play because of an injury.\n\nMiami began the rout with Rojas' equalizer in the 48th minute. Messi centered a pass to Rojas whose left-footed shot landed under the crossbar.\n\nSu\u00e1rez then fed a charging Messi with a touch pass to beat New York goalkeeper Carlos Coronel with a shot from 15 yards.\n\nRojas made it 3-1 with his second goal in the 62nd minute on an assist from Messi.\n\nMessi then contributed on former Barcelona teammate Su\u00e1rez's first goal in the 69th minute.\n\nSu\u00e1rez also struck in the 75th and 81st minutes before the Red Bulls (4-2-5, 17 points) closed the scoring on Emil Forsberg's penalty kick in stoppage time.\n\nNew York controlled possession early and eventually capitalized on a Miami defensive breakdown that resulted on Dante Vanzeir's goal in the 30th minute. Jos\u00e9 Carmona ran deep into the right wing of the large area and blasted a shot that bounced off the far post. An unmarked Vanzeir retrieved the deflection and converted from 15 yards.\n\nMessi had his only scoring opportunity of the first half in the 24th minute, when Coronel stopped his shot from the edge of the penalty area.\n\nMessi's former Barcelona teammate Jordi Alba missed his third straight game because of a hamstring injury.\n\nBoth clubs will continue MLS play next Saturday. Inter Miami will visit CF Montreal while the Red Bulls will host New England.\n\n___\n\nAP soccer: https://apnews.com/hub/soccer\n\nThe Associated Press", "source": {"uri": "sudbury.com", "dataType": Messi and Su\u00e1rez now have a league-leading 10 goals each, helping keep Inter Miami (7-2-3, 24 points) atop the Eastern Conference.\n\nThe win extended Miami's unbeaten string to six. The streak began after a 4-0 loss at New York on April 20, in which Messi did not play because of an injury.\n\nMiami began the rout with Rojas' equalizer in the 48th minute. Messi centered a pass to Rojas whose left-footed shot landed under the crossbar.\n\nSu\u00e1rez then fed a charging Messi with a touch pass to beat New York goalkeeper Carlos Coronel with a shot from 15 yards.\n\nRojas made it 3-1 with his second goal in the 62nd minute on an assist from Messi.\n\nMessi then contributed on former Barcelona teammate Su\u00e1rez's first goal in the 69th minute.\n\nSu\u00e1rez also struck in the 75th and 81st minutes before the Red Bulls (4-2-5, 17 points) closed the scoring on Emil Forsberg's penalty kick in stoppage time.\n\nNew York controlled possession early and eventually capitalized on a Miami defensive breakdown that resulted on Dante Vanzeir's goal in the 30th minute. Jos\u00e9 Carmona ran deep into the right wing of the large area and blasted a shot that bounced off the far post. An unmarked Vanzeir retrieved the deflection and converted from 15 yards.\n\nMessi had his only scoring opportunity of the first half in the 24th minute, when Coronel stopped his shot from the edge of the penalty area.\n\nMessi's former Barcelona teammate Jordi Alba missed his third straight game because of a hamstring injury.\n\nBoth clubs will continue MLS play next Saturday. {"uri": "2024-05-345317419", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "09:31:24", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T09:31:24Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-04T22:03:00Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8274509906768799, "url": "https://www.usnews.com/news/sports/articles/2024-05-04/messi-scores-a-goal-and-has-5-assists-to-lead-inter-miami-to-a-6-2-rout-of-red-bulls", "title": "Messi Has a Record-Setting Game With a Goal and 5 Assists in Inter Miami's 6-2 Win Over Red Bulls", "body": "FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla. (AP) -- Lionel Messi had a record-setting night for Inter Miami.\n\nHe scored a goal and had five assists as Inter Miami trounced the New York Red Bulls 6-2 on Saturday night -- with the Argentine great and eight-time Ballon d'Or winner as the game's best player setting no fewer than three Major League Soccer records.\n\nThe six goal contributions, five assists and five assists in a half were all MLS records.\n\nMessi, who earned the MLS Player of the Month Award for April, has now scored and assisted in six consecutive league matches.\n\n\"It has become redundant but it appears that he is always making history,\" Inter Miami coach Gerardo \"Tata\" Martino said. \"If something was missing, it was this -- to contribute in six goals.\"\n\nLuis Su\u00e1rez had three goals and Matias Rojas scored twice as Inter Miami got six unanswered goals to come back from a 1-0 halftime deficit. Messi and Su\u00e1rez now have a league-leading 10 goals each, helping keep Inter Miami (7-2-3, 24 points) atop the Eastern Conference.\n\nThe win extended Miami's unbeaten string to six. The streak began after a 4-0 loss at New York on April 20, in which Messi did not play because of an injury.\n\n\"When he is not available, obviously, the team feels it,\" Martino said.\n\nMiami began the rout with Rojas' equalizer in the 48th minute. Messi centered a pass to Rojas whose left-footed shot landed under the crossbar.\n\nSu\u00e1rez then fed a charging Messi with a touch pass and he beat New York goalkeeper Carlos Coronel with a shot from 15 yards.\n\nRojas made it 3-1 with his second goal in the 62nd minute on an assist from Messi. The 28-year-old Rojas joined Inter Miami on April 23 and entered the match to start the second half.\n\n\"This is the ultimate satisfaction for a goal scorer,\" Rojas said. \"It makes it even more special because we accomplished it at home.\"\n\nMessi then contributed on former Barcelona teammate Su\u00e1rez's first goal in the 69th minute.\n\n\"Leo makes it easier for all of us,\" Su\u00e1rez said. \"We know each other long enough. When we are on the pitch, we know how to spot each other without looking.\"\n\nSu\u00e1rez also struck in the 75th and 81st minutes before the Red Bulls (4-2-5, 17 points) closed the scoring on Emil Forsberg's penalty kick in stoppage time.\n\n\"We have many players that are capable of scoring,\" Martino said. \"At some points in the match we are going to find favorable moments. The issue is how we limit the unfavorable moments.\"\n\nNew York controlled possession early and eventually capitalized on a Miami defensive breakdown that resulted in Dante Vanzeir's goal in the 30th minute. Jos\u00e9 Carmona ran deep into the right wing of the large area and blasted a shot that bounced off the far post. An unmarked Vanzeir retrieved the deflection and converted from 15 yards.\n\nMessi had his only scoring opportunity of the first half in the 24th minute, when Coronel stopped his shot from the edge of the penalty area.\n\nMessi's former Barcelona teammate Jordi Alba missed his third straight game because of a hamstring injury.\n\nBoth clubs will continue MLS play next Saturday. Inter Miami visits CF Montreal while the Red Bulls play host to New England.\n\nCopyright 2024 The Associated Press. All rights reserved. {"uri": "2024-05-345422355", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "09:45:32", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T09:45:32Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T05:59:25Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8235294222831726, "url": "https://www.sportskeeda.com/football/lionel-messi-sets-2-mls-records-notches-5-assists-inter-miami-s-6-2-win-new-york-red-bulls", "title": "Lionel Messi sets 2 MLS records as he notches up 5 assists in Inter Miami's 6-2 win against New York Red Bulls", "body": "Lionel Messi further enhanced his legend in Inter Miami colours with a stunning performance for the side in their 6-2 win over New York Red Bulls. The Argentine great contributed a record-breaking goal and five assists for the Herons to keep them top of the Eastern Conference.\n\nThe tail end of last season and the early weeks of this season saw Messi's performance greatly disrupted by a series of injury problems. The 36-year-old, however, looks like he is back to peak fitness and is producing at the highest level.\n\nFresh from picking up the Player-of-the-Month award for April, Lionel Messi went and did one better against New York Red Bulls. He helped his side overcome a 1-0 deficit in the second half with a stunning performance that saw him notch up a goal and five assists.\n\nThe performance makes him the first player in MLS history to assist five goals in a single game. He also set a new record for most goal contributions in a single MLS game, with his six goal contributions taking him to 22 for the season.\n\nLionel Messi has now appeared in eight games in the MLS this season, and has ten goals and 12 assists to his name. His contribution against New York Red Bulls helped his side remain on top of the Eastern Conference standings with 24 points, albeit having played one game more than every other team. Cincinnati follow them on 21 points from 11 games.\n\nLionel Messi masterclass propels Inter Miami to win\n\nLionel Messi produced another vintage performance for Inter Miami as they claimed a comfortable 6-2 win over New York Red Bulls to begin May on a winning note. The Argentine great scored once and assisted all the other goals for his side in a dominant showing.\n\nInter Miami suffered their heaviest defeat of the season so far at the hands of New York Red Bulls back in March, enduring a 4-0 drubbing in the absence of the injured Messi. Their talisman was available for the return fixture at their Chase Stadium home, and he showed why he was needed.\n\nThe visitors took a first-half lead through Dante Vanzeir and held onto their advantage until half-time. At the break, Inter Miami boss Gerardo Martino made a change, introducing Paraguayan forward Matias Rojas for David Ruiz.\n\nWithin two minutes of the start of the second half, Messi found Rojas with a simple square pass, and he curled in an equaliser from outside the box. Two minutes later, Lionel Messi got his name on the scoresheet with a fine finish off a Luis Suarez assist.\n\nMessi continued to create as he played a delightful defence-splitting ball for Rojas to score his second of the evening. He then provided Luis Suarez with a delectable cross for the Uruguayan to volley home.\n\nLionel Messi was not done, as he played Suarez in to score their fifth goal after a delightful passing move between them. {"uri": "8112084524", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "08:40:28", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T08:40:28Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T08:39:56Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8235294222831726, "url": "https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/lionel-messi-mls-inter-miami-ny-red-bulls-483355-20240505", "title": "Lionel Messi broke two MLS records during stunning display as Inter Miami thrashed NY Red Bulls", "body": "Lionel Messi starred as Inter Miami beat New York Red Bulls in the MLS.\n\nLionel Messi reminded everyone that he's still got it after a stunning display for Inter Miami against New York Red Bulls.\n\nOn Saturday night, Inter Miami continued their fine start to the new Major League Soccer season as they thrashed NY Red Bulls at the Chase Stadium.\n\nA hat-trick from Luis Suarez, a brace by Matias Rojas and a Messi goal sealed a 6-2 victory for Gerardo Martino's side.\n\nMessi produced a vintage display as he had a hand in all six goals.\n\nDoing so, the Argentine legend broke not one, but two MLS records.\n\nMessi broke the record for the most assists in one match after registering five against the NY Red Bulls. He also set a new benchmark for the most goal contributions in a game as he recorded six.\n\nTo make his achievement even greater, both records were broken during the second half of the match.\n\nSpeaking after the match, Inter Miami boss Martino said: \"Messi had exceptional games in Barcelona, during my time with him. But I also remember a semifinal with Paraguay in the Copa America in Chile, where he didn't score a goal and he was still the best player on the field. In Barcelona, he had a game against Valencia where we were losing 2-0 and then won 3-2 with three goals from him.\n\n\"And there was another against Sevilla where we were losing 1-0 and then he scored three goals and we won 4-1. I always say this, and it's redundant at this point, but he always does something new. To have involvement in all six goals of a team's 6-2 is something that will be difficult to see again.\"\n\nHe added: \"He's not the key component just because of this game. He always is. Today, the association between Messi and Luis in the second half worked well, like old times.\n\n\"When they find each other, the team is able to back them up in the game, and when we find space, they {"uri": "8111915677", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "05:43:17", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T05:43:17Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T05:42:34Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8196078538894653, "url": "https://www.thenationalnews.com/sport/football/2024/05/05/lionel-messi-sets-three-mls-records-after-five-assists-and-goal-in-inter-miami-victory/", "title": "Lionel Messi sets three MLS records after five assists and goal in Inter Miami victory", "body": "Lionel Messi set three Major League Soccer records on Saturday night after scoring a goal and providing five assists in Inter Miami's 6-2 win over New York Red Bulls at Chase Stadium.\n\nThe six goal contributions, five assists, and five assists in a half were all MLS firsts. Messi, who earned the MLS Player of the Month Award for April, has now scored and assisted in six consecutive league matches.\n\n\"It has become redundant but it appears that he is always making history,\" Inter Miami manager Gerardo 'Tata' Martino said. \"If something was missing, it was this -- to contribute in six goals.\"\n\nLuis Suarez bagged a hat-trick and Matias Rojas scored twice as Miami came flying back from a 1-0 halftime deficit. Messi and Suarez now have a league-leading 10 goals each, helping keep Miami atop the Eastern Conference with 24 points.\n\nThe win extended Miami's unbeaten run to six matches. The streak began after a 4-0 loss at New York on April 20, in which Messi did not play because of an injury.\n\n\"When he is not available, obviously, the team feels it,\" Martino said.\n\nMiami began the rout with Rojas' equaliser in the 48th minute. Messi centered a pass to the Paraguay midfielder, whose left-footed shot landed under the crossbar.\n\nSuarez then fed a charging Messi with a touch pass and he beat New York goalkeeper Carlos Coronel with a shot from 15 yards.\n\nRojas made it 3-1 with his second goal in the 62nd minute with an assist from Messi. The 28-year-old Rojas joined Miami on April 23 and entered the match to start the second half.\n\n\"This is the ultimate satisfaction for a goal scorer,\" Rojas said. \"It makes it even more special because we accomplished it at home.\"\n\nMessi then contributed to former Barcelona teammate Suarez's first goal in the 69th minute.\n\n\"Leo makes it easier for all of us,\" Suarez said. \"We know each other long enough. When we are on the pitch, we know how to spot each other without looking.\"\n\nSuarez also struck in the 75th and 81st minutes before the Red Bulls closed the scoring with Emil Forsberg's penalty in stoppage time.\n\n\"We have many players that are capable of scoring,\" Martino said. \"At some points in the match, we are going to find favourable moments. The issue is how we limit the unfavourable moments.\"\n\nNew York controlled possession early and eventually capitalised on a Miami defensive breakdown that resulted in Dante Vanzeir's goal in the 30th minute. Jose Carmona ran deep on the right wing and blasted a shot that bounced off the far post. An unmarked Vanzeir retrieved the deflection and converted from 15 yards.\n\nMessi had his only scoring opportunity of the first half in the 24th minute when Coronel stopped his shot from the edge of the penalty area.\n\nMessi's former Barcelona teammate Jordi Alba missed his third straight game because of a hamstring injury.\n\nBoth clubs will continue MLS play next Saturday. {"uri": "8112256736", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "11:23:01", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T11:23:01Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T11:22:16Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8117647171020508, "url": "https://www.dailysabah.com/sports/football/messi-sets-mls-assist-record-as-inter-miami-destroy-red-bulls-6-2", "title": "Messi sets MLS assist record as Inter Miami destroy Red Bulls 6-2", "body": "Lionel Messi dazzled in a record-breaking performance for Inter Miami, scoring a goal and providing five assists in a stunning 6-2 victory over the New York Red Bulls.\n\nThe Argentine legend, an eight-time Ballon d'Or winner, not only earned the title of the game's standout player but also set three impressive Major League Soccer (MLS) records.\n\nHis six goal contributions, five assists, and five assists in a single half all etched his name in MLS history books. Messi's incredible form saw him clinch the MLS Player of the Month Award for April, marking his scoring and assisting streak in six consecutive league matches.\n\n\"It has become redundant but it appears that he is always making history,\" Inter Miami coach Gerardo \"Tata\" Martino said. \"If something was missing, it was this - to contribute in six goals.\"\n\nLuis Su\u00e1rez scored three goals, and Matias Rojas scored twice as Inter Miami got six unanswered goals to come back from a 1-0 halftime deficit. Messi and Su\u00e1rez now have a league-leading 10 goals each, helping keep Inter Miami (7-2-3, 24 points) atop the Eastern Conference.\n\nThe win extended Miami's unbeaten streak to six. The streak began after a 4-0 loss at New York on April 20, in which Messi did not play because of an injury.\n\n\"When he is not available, obviously, the team feels it,\" Martino said.\n\nMiami began the rout with Rojas' equalizer in the 48th minute. Messi centered a pass to Rojas, whose left-footed shot landed under the crossbar.\n\nSu\u00e1rez then fed a charging Messi with a touch pass, and he beat New York goalkeeper Carlos Coronel with a shot from 15 yards.\n\nRojas made it 3-1 with his second goal in the 62nd minute on an assist from Messi. The 28-year-old Rojas joined Inter Miami on April 23 and entered the match to start the second half.\n\n\"This is the ultimate satisfaction for a goal scorer,\" Rojas said. \"It makes it even more special because we accomplished it at home.\"\n\nMessi then contributed to former Barcelona teammate Su\u00e1rez's first goal in the 69th minute.\n\n\"Leo makes it easier for all of us,\" Su\u00e1rez said. \"We know each other long enough. When we are on the pitch, we know how to spot each other without looking.\"\n\nSu\u00e1rez also struck in the 75th and 81st minutes before the Red Bulls (4-2-5, 17 points) closed the scoring on Emil Forsberg's penalty kick in stoppage time.\n\n\"We have many players that are capable of scoring,\" Martino said. \"At some points in the match, we are going to find favorable moments. The issue is how we limit the unfavorable moments.\"\n\nNew York controlled possession early and eventually capitalized on a Miami defensive breakdown that resulted in Dante Vanzeir's goal in the 30th minute. Jos\u00e9 Carmona ran deep into the right wing of the large area and blasted a shot that bounced off the far post. An unmarked Vanzeir retrieved the deflection and converted from 15 yards.\n\nMessi had his only scoring opportunity of the first half in the 24th minute, when Coronel stopped his shot from the edge of the penalty area.\n\nMessi's former Barcelona teammate Jordi Alba missed his third straight game because of a hamstring injury.\n\nBoth clubs will continue MLS play next Saturday. {"uri": "8111920302", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "05:48:30", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T05:48:30Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T05:48:09Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8039215803146362, "url": "https://www.news9live.com/sports/football/watch-lionel-messi-sets-mls-records-with-five-assists-and-a-goal-as-inter-miami-thrash-new-york-red-bulls-6-2-2524059", "title": "WATCH: Lionel Messi sets MLS records with five assists and a goal as Inter Miami thrash New York Red Bulls 6-2", "body": "New Delhi: Star duo of Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez took centre stage as a rampant Inter Miami crushed the New York Red Bulls 6-2 at Florida's Chase Stadium in Major League Soccer on Saturday. Messi made it a record outing for himself and partnered with Suarez to plot the New York Red Bulls' destruction, all in the second half.\n\nThe Eastern Conference leaders made a brilliant comeback after trailing 1-0 at halftime all due to the courtesy of two-goal substitute Matias Rojas. The Red Bulls had defeated a Messi-less Miami back in March and Inter paid them all back with their ferocious second-half performance. It was Dante Vanzeir who handed New York a lead in the 30th minute.\n\nInter Miami's first-half performance was lackluster which called upon Rojas' incoming for the second half. He made an impact just three minutes into the field as he collected a pass from Messi and evaded two defenders before unleashing a terrific drive from 25 yards behind.\n\nAs they say, Messi entering the scoresheet is inevitable, and Miami was 2-1 up when Rojas dispossessed Wikelman Carmona and found Suarez who set up the World Cup winner for a clinical finish. Messi set up another when while splitting the New York defense and providing a brilliant pass to Rojas who chipped over Carlos Coronel to score a brace.\n\nJust when the game was reaching the final moments, Luis Suarez entered the scoresheet netting a hat-trick, all with the help of Messi's setups. He first volleyed a chipped ball from Messi and minutes later played a passing game with Messi before striking the ball into the net and taking Miami 5-1 up. The sixth goal for Miami arrived when Suarez turned another Messi pass from close range with a tight angle.\n\nNew York, although scored a late penalty which was more of a consolatory goal as Emil Forsberg netted the second for NY Red Bulls. Inter Miami are table toppers with 24 points while the Red Bulls sit fourth with 17 points\n\nWith his five assists, Messi set a new MLS record for most assists in a game. Also, his six-goal involvements also set the record for most goal contributions in a single game. {"uri": "8111776947", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "02:31:18", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T02:31:18Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T02:30:33Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.800000011920929, "url": "https://medicinehatnews.com/sports/national-sports/2024/05/04/messi-has-a-recordsetting-game-with-a-goal-and-5-assists-in-inter-miamis-62-win-over-red-bulls/", "title": "Messi has a record-setting game with a goal and 5 assists in Inter Miami's 6-2 win over Red Bulls - Medicine Hat News", "body": "SUBSCRIBE NOW FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla. (AP) - Lionel Messi had a record setting night for Inter Miami. He scored a goal and had five assists as Inter Miami trounced the New York Red Bulls 6-2 on Saturday night - with the Argentine great and eight-time Ballon d'Or winner as the game's best player setting no fewer than three Major League Soccer records in the effort. The six goal contributions, five assists and five assists in a half were all MLS records. Messi, who earned the MLS Player of the Month Award for April, has now scored and assisted in six consecutive league matches. Luis Su\u00c3\u00a1rez had three goals and Matias Rojas scored twice as Inter Miami got six unanswered goals to come back from a 1-0 deficit at halftime. Messi and Su\u00c3\u00a1rez now have a league-leading 10 goals each, helping keep Inter Miami (7-2-3, 24 points) atop the Eastern Conference. The win extended Miami's unbeaten string to six. The streak began after a 4-0 loss at New York on April 20, in which Messi did not play because of an injury. Miami began the rout with Rojas' equalizer in the 48th minute. Messi centered a pass to Rojas whose left-footed shot landed under the crossbar. Su\u00c3\u00a1rez then fed a charging Messi with a touch pass to beat New York goalkeeper Carlos Coronel with a shot from 15 yards. Rojas made it 3-1 with his second goal in the 62nd minute on an assist from Messi. Messi then contributed on former Barcelona teammate Su\u00c3\u00a1rez's first goal in the 69th minute. Su\u00c3\u00a1rez also struck in the 75th and 81st minutes before the Red Bulls (4-2-5, 17 points) closed the scoring on Emil Forsberg's penalty kick in stoppage time. New York controlled possession early and eventually capitalized on a Miami defensive breakdown that resulted on Dante Vanzeir's goal in the 30th minute. Jos\u00e9 Carmona ran deep into the right wing of the large area and blasted a shot that bounced off the far post. An unmarked Vanzeir retrieved the deflection and converted from 15 yards. Messi had his only scoring opportunity of the first half in the 24th minute, when Coronel stopped his shot from the edge of the penalty area. Messi's former Barcelona teammate Jordi Alba missed his third straight game because of a hamstring injury. Both clubs will continue MLS play next Saturday. MLS is, as expected, no different.\n\nOn Saturday, Messi made it seven consecutive games with a goal and, if that wasn't enough, he added five assists for good measure. That brings him 10 goals and 12 assists already. He's played in just eight matches.\n\nSaturday's 6-2 win over the New York Red Bulls was the eighth match of Messi's season, and it was probably the most impressive yet. Just a month ago, these same Red Bulls blasted a Messi-less Miami 4-0 at Red Bull Arena. {"uri": "8112128758", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "09:21:48", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T09:21:48Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T09:21:26Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.800000011920929, "url": "https://www.citizen.co.za/sport/soccer/world-soccer/five-assists-goal-messi-hat-trick-suarez-miami-hit-six/", "title": "Five assists and goal for Messi, hat-trick for Suarez as Miami hit six | The Citizen", "body": "Inter Miami's Lionel Messi took the New York Red Bulls apart in the MLS on Saturday. Picture: Chris ARJOON / AFP\n\nLuis Suarez scored a hat-trick and Lionel Messi had an incredible five assists and a goal in the second half as a rampant Inter Miami crushed the New York Red Bulls 6-2 in Major League Soccer on Saturday.\n\nTwo-goal substitute Matias Rojas sparked the second half rout from Eastern Conference leaders Inter after New York had led 1-0 at the break.\n\nWithout Messi, Miami had fallen to a 4-0 defeat to the Red Bulls in New York in March, but they more than avenged that loss with a merciless second-half demolition job.\n\nMessi's five assists, which all came in the second half, are a new record for an MLS game and he now has 10 goals and 12 assists in eight league appearances so far this season.\n\nOperating behind Suarez, Messi's passing through the slightest of gaps, taking advantage of his former Barcelona teammate's telepathic understanding of his intentions, was simply too much for the Red Bulls, who came into the game third in the East.\n\n\"Obviously what we have seen today surprises people, because you don't see that in football,\" said Suarez of Messi's five assists.\n\n\"But as a teammate and someone who knows him, nothing surprises me about him,\" added the Uruguayan.\n\nThe 37-year-old Suarez's triples takes his own tally to 10 in 11 league games for Miami and despite no longer being blessed with pace, his deadly finishing clearly remains intact.\n\nWhile it was the kind of attacking display that Miami owners Jorge Mas and David Beckham surely dreamed of when they brought in the star pairing, there was no sign of the explosiveness in the opening half.\n\nDante Vanzeir had put the Red Bulls ahead in the 30th minute, slotting home after Wikelman Carmona's shot came out off the post, following a superb through pass from Swedish playmaker Emil Forsberg.\n\nGerardo Martino's Inter lacked intensity and ideas in the opening 45 minutes but the coach's half-time change transformed the game.\n\nParaguayan Rojas was introduced for the second half and took just three minutes to make an impact, collecting a pass from Messi and evading two defenders before unleashing an unstoppable drive from 25 yards out.\n\nMessi then put Miami in front when Rojas robbed Carmona and found Suarez, who slipped the ball to the Argentine, who made no mistake.\n\nThe eight-time Ballon d'Or winner then turned provider again as he split the New York defense with a brilliant through ball to Rojas, who deftly chipped over the advancing Carlos Coronel.\n\nSuarez's hat trick then came in the space of 12 minutes -- he first found the target when Messi chipped in a ball from the right and the Uruguayan hooked home a volley.\n\nIt was playground stuff minutes later when Suarez played a one-two with Messi and then poked home to make it 5-1.\n\nMessi was yet again the creator for Miami's sixth, which Suarez turned in from close range from the tightest of angles.\n\n\"The partnership of him (Messi) and Luis (Suarez) in the second half worked very well, like in old times (...) They were very influential in the game,\" said Martino.\n\nNew York had a late consolation in the final seconds with a penalty from Forsberg.", "source": {"uri": "citizen.co.za", "dataType": "news", {"uri": "8112019886", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "07:35:49", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T07:35:49Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T07:35:09Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7960784435272217, "url": "https://www.khaleejtimes.com/sports/football/watch-just-like-old-times-messi-gets-five-assists-and-goal-suarez-nets-hat-trick", "title": "Watch: Just like old times, Messi gets five assists and goal, Suarez nets hat trick", "body": "Inter Miami forward Lionel Messi controls the ball during the MLS match against New York Red Bulls. -- Reuters\n\nLuis Suarez scored a hat trick and Lionel Messi had an incredible five assists and a goal in the second half as a rampant Inter Miami crushed the New York Red Bulls 6-2 in Major League Soccer on Saturday.\n\nTwo-goal substitute Matias Rojas sparked the second half rout from Eastern Conference leaders Inter after New York had led 1-0 at the break.\n\nWithout Messi, Miami had fallen to a 4-0 defeat to the Red Bulls in New York in March, but they more than avenged that loss with a merciless second-half demolition job.\n\nMessi's five assists, which all came in the second half, are a new record for an MLS game and he now has 10 goals and 12 assists in eight league appearances so far this season.\n\nOperating behind Suarez, Messi's passing through the slightest of gaps, taking advantage of his former Barcelona teammate's telepathic understanding of his intentions, was simply too much for the Red Bulls, who came into the game third in the East.\n\n\"Obviously what we have seen today surprises people, because you don't see that in football,\" said Suarez of Messi's five assists.\n\n\"But as a teammate and someone who knows him, nothing surprises me about him,\" added the Uruguayan.\n\nThe 37-year-old Suarez's triples takes his own tally to 10 in 11 league games for Miami and despite no longer being blessed with pace, his deadly finishing clearly remains intact.\n\nWhile it was the kind of attacking display that Miami owners Jorge Mas and David Beckham surely dreamed of when they brought in the star pairing, there was no sign of the explosiveness in the opening half.\n\nDante Vanzeir had put the Red Bulls ahead in the 30th minute, slotting home after Wikelman Carmona's shot came out off the post, following a superb through pass from Swedish playmaker Emil Forsberg.\n\nGerardo Martino's Inter lacked intensity and ideas in the opening 45 minutes but the coach's half-time change transformed the game.\n\nParaguayan Rojas was introduced for the second half and took just three minutes to make an impact, collecting a pass from Messi and evading two defenders before unleashing an unstoppable drive from 25 yards out.\n\nMessi then put Miami in front when Rojas robbed Carmona and found Suarez, who slipped the ball to the Argentine, who made no mistake.\n\nThe eight-time Ballon d'Or winner then turned provider again as he split the New York defense with a brilliant through ball to Rojas, who deftly chipped over the advancing Carlos Coronel.\n\nSuarez's hat trick then came in the space of 12 minutes -- he first found the target when Messi chipped in a ball from the right and the Uruguayan hooked home a volley.\n\nIt was playground stuff minutes later when Suarez played a one-two with Messi and then poked home to make it 5-1.\n\nMessi was yet again the creator for Miami's sixth, which Suarez turned in from close range from the tightest of angles.\n\n\"The partnership of him (Messi) and Luis (Suarez) in the second half worked very well, like in old times (...) They were very influential in the game,\" said Martino.\n\nNew York had a late consolation in the final seconds with a penalty from Forsberg.", "source": {"uri": "khaleejtimes.com", "dataType": {"uri": "8111778115", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "02:33:26", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T02:33:26Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T02:32:44Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7921568751335144, "url": "http://www.espn.com.au/football/report/_/gameId/692746", "title": "Inter Miami CF 6-2 New York Red Bulls (5 May, 2024) Game Analysis - ESPN (AU)", "body": "Lionel Messi scored a goal and had five assists as Inter Miami CF trounced the New York Red Bulls 6-2 on Saturday night.\n\nMessi, who earned the MLS Player of the Month Award for April, has now scored and assisted in six consecutive league matches. His five assists and six goal contributions against Red Bulls are both MLS single-game records.\n\nLuis Su\u00e1rez had three goals and Mat\u00edas Rojas scored twice as Inter Miami got six unanswered goals to come back from a 1-0 deficit at halftime. Messi and Su\u00e1rez now have a league-leading 10 goals each, helping keep Inter Miami (7-2-3, 24 points) atop the Eastern Conference.\n\nThe win extended Miami's unbeaten string to six. The streak began after a 4-0 loss at New York on April 20, in which Messi did not play because of an injury.\n\nMiami began the rout with Rojas' equalizer in the 48th minute. Messi centered a pass to Rojas whose left-footed shot landed under the crossbar.\n\nSu\u00e1rez then fed a charging Messi with a touch pass to beat New York goalkeeper Carlos Coronel with a shot from 15 yards.\n\nRojas made it 3-1 with his second goal in the 62nd minute on an assist from Messi.\n\nMessi then contributed on former Barcelona teammate Su\u00e1rez's first goal in the 69th minute.\n\nSu\u00e1rez also struck in the 75th and 81st minutes before the Red Bulls (4-2-5, 17 points) closed the scoring on Emil Forsberg's penalty kick in stoppage time.\n\nNew York controlled possession early and eventually capitalized on a Miami defensive breakdown that resulted on Dante Vanzeir's goal in the 30th minute. Jos\u00e9 Carmona ran deep into the right wing of the large area and blasted a shot that bounced off the far post. An unmarked Vanzeir retrieved the deflection and converted from 15 yards.\n\nMessi had his only scoring opportunity of the first half in the 24th minute, when Coronel stopped his shot from the edge of the penalty area.\n\nMessi's former Barcelona teammate Jordi Alba missed his third straight game because of a hamstring injury.\n\nBoth clubs will continue MLS play next Saturday. {"uri": "2024-05-345636649", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "13:26:29", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T13:26:29Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T11:56:47Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7921568751335144, "url": "https://www.sportskeeda.com/football/news-always-something-new-tata-martino-stunned-lionel-messi-racks-six-goal-contributions-one-game-inter-miami", "title": "\"Always does something new\" - Tata Martino stunned as Lionel Messi racks up six-goal contributions in one game for Inter Miami", "body": "Inter Miami boss Tata Martino was all praises for Lionel Messi after his stunning performance in Inter Miami's 6-2 victory against New York Red Bulls on Saturday, May 4.\n\nSpeaking to the media after the match, Tata Martino recalled Messi's 'exceptional' games in his former club, Barcelona. He referred to a few specific matches where Messi made a difference, including two against Valencia and Sevilla.\n\n\"Messi had exceptional games in Barcelona, during my time with him. But I also remember a semifinal with Paraguay in the Copa America in Chile, where he didn't score a goal and he was still the best player on the field.\n\n\"In Barcelona, he had a game against Valencia where we were losing 2-0 and then won 3-2 with three goals from him. And there was another against Sevilla where we were losing 1-0 and then he scored three goals and we won 4-1,\" Martino said (via GOAL).\n\nFurther, the former Argentina coach also pointed out how the Argentine talisman 'always does something new' in every game. Tata Martino has previously managed Lionel Messi in his former club, Barcelona in the 2013-14 season and the Argentina national team between 2014 and 2016.\n\n\"I always say this, and it's redundant at this point, but he always does something new. To have involvement in all six goals of a team's 6-2 is something that will be difficult to see again.\" Martino continued.\n\nLionel Messi was involved in all six goals Inter Miami scored in their clash against the New York Red Bulls, providing 5 assists and scoring one goal. La Pulga has 12 goals and 11 assists in 11 appearances across all competitions for the Herons this season.\n\nLionel Messi makes records as he provides 5 assists in Inter Miami's 6-2 win over New York Red Bulls\n\nAfter Saturday's match, Lionel Messi became the first player in the history of Major League Soccer to register five assists in a single match. He also became the player with the most goal contributions in one match in the MLS, being involved in all six goals the Herons scored in their clash against the Red Bulls.\n\nInter Miami were 0-1 down at half-time in their fixture against NY Red Bulls. However, things took a major paradigm shift in the second half as La Pulga decided to be the cheat code for the Herons once again.\n\nLionel Messi provided his first assist to Matias Rojas in the 48th minute and scored the next goal two minutes later in the 50th minute, giving Inter Miami the lead with 2-1. Rojas stepped up once again to score his second goal of the night in the 62nd minute, making it 3-1.\n\nLuis Suarez scored the final three goals from Inter Miami's side, all of which were assisted by his former Barcelona teammate Lionel Messi. El Pistolero scored his first hattrick of the night for Inter Miami, leading the team to a 6-2 victory. The final goal of the night was a penalty kick converted at stoppage time by Emil Forsberg for the NY Red Bulls.\n\nInter Miami is currently at the top of the table of the MLS Eastern Conference with {"uri": "8112248587", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "11:16:17", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T11:16:17Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T11:15:12Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7921568751335144, "url": "https://weeklyvoice.com/mls-2023-24-messi-sets-assists-record-as-inter-miami-trounce-ny-red-bulls/", "title": "MLS 2023-24: Messi sets assists record as Inter Miami trounce NY Red Bulls - Weekly Voice", "body": "Washington, May 5 (VOICE) Lionel Messi set a new Major League Soccer (MLS) record of five assists in a single match as leaders Inter Miami romped to a 6-2 home win over New York Red Bulls. Luis Suarez's hat-trick was relegated to a support act as Messi, who also scored a goal, continued his outstanding run of form for the Florida outfit on Saturday.\n\nNew York went ahead on the half-hour at Chase stadium through Dante Vanzeir, who thumped home a first-time effort after Wikelman Carmon's shot cannoned off the far post.\n\nMatias Rojas put Inter Miami on level terms by receiving Messi's pass before curling a 20-yard effort into the top-right corner, reports .\n\nRojas and Suarez then linked up before the latter's deft pass released Messi, who gave his side the lead by firing home from 12 yards.\n\nInter Miami extended their advantage just after the hour through the impressive Rojas, who ran onto Messi's sublime through ball and sent a delightful chip over the head of goalkeeper Carlos Coronel.\n\nThe almost telepathic understanding between Messi and Suarez was on display as the Uruguayan striker sent an acrobatic volley into the far corner after the Inter Miami captain's lofted cross.\n\nThe former Barcelona teammates were irrepressible, and they again exchanged a series of slick passes before Suarez stroked home his side's fifth goal.\n\nSuarez, who joined Inter Miami on a free transfer in January, added to New York's misery by running onto Messi's pass and rounding Coronel before threading home his third goal from the tightest of angles.\n\nThe visitors grabbed a late consolation goal when Emil Forsberg converted from the spot after Marcelo Weigandt's mistimed challenge on John Tolkin.\n\nThe result leaves Inter Miami three points clear of second-placed Cincinnati in the Eastern Conference standings while New York Red Bulls remain fourth with 17 points.\n\nMessi has now scored 12 goals and provided 11 assists in 11 games for Inter Miami this season while Suarez has 12 goals and seven assists in 15 outings.\n\nMartino hails Messi-Suarez double act\n\nInter Miami manager Gerardo Martino hailed the attacking partnership of Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez in the team's 6-2 home rout of New York Red Bulls on Saturday.\n\n\"Messi always makes the difference,\" Martino told a news conference after the match at Chase Stadium in Fort Lauderdale. \"Today the partnership between him and Luis in the second half worked very well, like in old times. They really were very influential in the game.\"\n\nThe other player to impress for Inter Miami was Paraguayan midfielder Matias Rojas, who scored twice and also showed a remarkable understanding with Messi. \"The truth is that everyone had a phenomenal impact in the game, but Leo probably did something historic with five assists and a goal,\" Martino said.\n\n\"I always say the same thing: it is redundant to talk about him [Messi] because it seems like he always does something new. If something was missing it was this: having an impact on the six goals that a team scores. It's going to be difficult to see something like this again.\"\n\nDespite the emphatic nature of the win, Martino said his team had plenty of scope for improvement. \"I think that in the first half, we couldn't find the passes between the lines,\" he said. \"We couldn't advance on the outside either because of the way they were set up. We knew we had to take some more risks and move the ball with more authority, which we did in the second half,\" the Argentine coach added.", "source": {"uri": "weeklyvoice.com", "dataType": "news", Miami has not lost in league play since falling 4-0 to the Red Bulls on the road March 23.\n\n\"I think it's time for us to show them how good we really are,\" Miami midfielder Robert Taylor said. \"When we went there, we were not ourselves at all. I think now it's kind of redemption for us.\n\n\"(Losses) always push us more. Last time we played them, we got embarrassed by them, so we want to make sure that doesn't happen, and we take the three points this time.\"\n\nOn Thursday, Messi was named the MLS Player of the Month for April after the Argentine star registered six goals and four assists in four appearances last month.\n\nMessi made MLS history last weekend with his brace and assist, breaking the record for the most goal contributions in a player's first seven games to start the season. He also became the first player in MLS history to register multiple goal contributions in five straight matches.\n\nALSO READ: Man City's Foden and Shaw win FWA Footballer of the Year awards\n\n\"They're a team with high quality, especially with Lionel Messi as a striker or winger in the half-space between the lines, so we have to defend very strong,\" Red Bulls coach Sandro Schwarz said.\n\nThe Red Bulls (4-1-5, 17 points), third in the Eastern Conference, will look to improve on their 6-3-0 regular-season record against Miami. The Red Bulls are 3-1-0 in Miami and have points in five of six away matches this season.\n\n\"In the first game, the home game with our supporters against Miami, the transition moments were very good. We need the same structure and the same transition moments on Saturday.\"\n\nMidfielder Lewis Morgan leads New York with seven goals this season, while forward Dante Vanzeir leads the team in assists with six.\n\n- Reuters\n\nPredicted 11s Inter Miami: Callender; Weigandt, Aviles, Freire, Alba; Ruiz, Busquets, Gressel; Messi, Suarez, Taylor New York Red Bulls: Miguel; Tolkin, Reyes, Nealis, Nealis; Forsberg, Edelman, Amaya, Carmona; Morgan, Vanzeir Streaming/telecast information\n\nWhen will Inter Miami vs New York Red Bulls match start?\n\nThe MLS match between Inter Miami and New York Red Bulls will kick off on May 5, 2024 at 5:00 a.m. IST.\n\nWhere to watch the Inter Miami vs New York Red Bulls match in India?\n\nThe MLS match between Inter Miami and New York Red Bulls will not be broadcast in India. {"uri": "2024-05-345370030", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "09:42:01", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T09:42:01Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T01:45:08Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7607843279838562, "url": "https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20240505-five-assists-for-messi-hat-trick-for-suarez-as-miami-hit-six", "title": "Five assists and goal for Messi, hat-trick for Suarez as Miami hit six", "body": "Fort Lauderdale (United States) (AFP) - Luis Suarez scored a hat-trick and Lionel Messi had an incredible five assists and a goal in the second half as a rampant Inter Miami crushed the New York Red Bulls 6-2 in Major League Soccer on Saturday.\n\nTwo-goal substitute Matias Rojas sparked the second half rout from Eastern Conference leaders Inter after New York had led 1-0 at the break.\n\nWithout Messi, Miami had fallen to a 4-0 defeat to the Red Bulls in New York in March, but they more than avenged that loss with a merciless second-half demolition job.\n\nMessi's five assists, which all came in the second half, are a new record for an MLS game and he now has 10 goals and 12 assists in eight league appearances so far this season.\n\nOperating behind Suarez, Messi's passing through the slightest of gaps, taking advantage of his former Barcelona teammate's telepathic understanding of his intentions, was simply too much for the Red Bulls, who came into the game third in the East.\n\n\"Obviously what we have seen today surprises people, because you don't see that in football,\" said Suarez of Messi's five assists.\n\n\"But as a teammate and someone who knows him, nothing surprises me about him,\" added the Uruguayan.\n\nThe 37-year-old Suarez's triples takes his own tally to 10 in 11 league games for Miami and despite no longer being blessed with pace, his deadly finishing clearly remains intact.\n\nWhile it was the kind of attacking display that Miami owners Jorge Mas and David Beckham surely dreamed of when they brought in the star pairing, there was no sign of the explosiveness in the opening half.\n\nDante Vanzeir had put the Red Bulls ahead in the 30th minute, slotting home after Wikelman Carmona's shot came out off the post, following a superb through pass from Swedish playmaker Emil Forsberg.\n\nGerardo Martino's Inter lacked intensity and ideas in the opening 45 minutes but the coach's half-time change transformed the game.\n\nParaguayan Rojas was introduced for the second half and took just three minutes to make an impact, collecting a pass from Messi and evading two defenders before unleashing an unstoppable drive from 25 yards out.\n\nMessi then put Miami in front when Rojas robbed Carmona and found Suarez, who slipped the ball to the Argentine, who made no mistake.\n\nThe eight-time Ballon d'Or winner then turned provider again as he split the New York defense with a brilliant through ball to Rojas, who deftly chipped over the advancing Carlos Coronel.\n\nSuarez's hat trick then came in the space of 12 minutes -- he first found the target when Messi chipped in a ball from the right and the Uruguayan hooked home a volley.\n\nIt was playground stuff minutes later when Suarez played a one-two with Messi and then poked home to make it 5-1.\n\nMessi was yet again the creator for Miami's sixth, which Suarez turned in from close range from the tightest of angles.\n\n\"The partnership of him (Messi) and Luis (Suarez) in the second half worked very well, like in old times (...) They were very influential in the game,\" said Martino.\n\nNew York had a late consolation in the final seconds with a penalty from Forsberg.", "source": {"uri": "france24.com", "dataType": "news", {"uri": "8112022586", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "07:38:00", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T07:38:00Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T07:37:36Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7607843279838562, "url": "https://www.aljazeera.com/sports/2024/5/5/messi-and-saurez-lead-inter-miamis-6-2-mls-win-over-new-york-red-bulls", "title": "'Like old times': Messi and Suarez shine in Inter Miami's 6-2 win", "body": "Messi had a record five assists and scored a goal, while Suarez scored a hat-trick in the Eastern Conference game.\n\nLuis Suarez scored a hat-trick and Lionel Messi had an incredible five assists and a goal in the second half as a rampant Inter Miami crushed the New York Red Bulls 6-2 in Major League Soccer.\n\nTwo-goal substitute Matias Rojas sparked the second-half rout from Eastern Conference leaders Inter after New York had led 1-0 at the break.\n\nWithout Messi, Miami had fallen to a 4-0 defeat to the Red Bulls in New York in March, but they more than avenged that loss with a merciless second-half demolition job on Saturday.\n\nMessi's five assists, which all came in the second half, are a new record for an MLS game and he now has 10 goals and 12 assists in eight league appearances so far this season.\n\nOperating behind Suarez, Messi's passing through the slightest of gaps, taking advantage of his former Barcelona teammate's telepathic understanding of his intentions, was simply too much for the Red Bulls, who came into the game third in the East.\n\n\"Obviously what we have seen today surprises people, because you don't see that in football,\" said Suarez of Messi's five assists.\n\n\"But as a teammate and someone who knows him, nothing surprises me about him,\" added the Uruguayan.\n\nThe 37-year-old Suarez's triples take his own tally to 10 in 11 league games for Miami and despite no longer being blessed with pace, his deadly finishing clearly remains intact.\n\nWhile it was the kind of attacking display that Miami owners Jorge Mas and David Beckham surely dreamed of when they brought in the star pairing, there was no sign of the explosiveness in the opening half.\n\nDante Vanzeir had put the Red Bulls ahead in the 30th minute, slotting home after Wikelman Carmona's shot came out off the post, following a superb through pass from Swedish playmaker Emil Forsberg.\n\nGerardo Martino's Inter lacked intensity and ideas in the opening 45 minutes but the coach's half-time change transformed the game.\n\nParaguayan Rojas was introduced for the second half and took just three minutes to make an impact, collecting a pass from Messi and evading two defenders before unleashing an unstoppable drive from 25 yards out.\n\nMessi then put Miami in front when Rojas robbed Carmona and found Suarez, who slipped the ball to the Argentinian, who made no mistake.\n\nThe eight-time Ballon d'Or winner then turned provider again as he split the New York defence with a brilliant through ball to Rojas, who deftly chipped over the advancing Carlos Coronel.\n\nSuarez's hat-trick then came in the space of 12 minutes - he first found the target when Messi chipped in a ball from the right and the Uruguayan hooked home a volley.\n\nIt was playground stuff minutes later when Suarez played a one-two with Messi and then poked home to make it 5-1.\n\nMessi was yet again the creator for Miami's sixth, which Suarez turned in from close range from the tightest of angles.\n\n\"The partnership of him [Messi] and Luis [Suarez] in the second half worked very well, like in old times ... They were very influential in the game,\" said Martino.\n\nNew York had a late consolation in the final seconds with a penalty from Forsberg.", "source": {"uri": "aljazeera.com", "dataType": "news", Messi and Su\u00e1rez now have a league-leading 10 goals each, helping keep Inter Miami (7-2-3, 24 points) atop the Eastern Conference.\n\nInter Miami's previous scoring high in a game had been five goals against Cincinnati in October of 2021.\n\nThe win extended Miami's unbeaten string to six. The streak began after a 4-0 loss at New York on April 20, in which Messi did not play because of an injury.\n\nMiami began the rout with Rojas' equalizer in the 48th minute. Messi centered a pass to Rojas whose left-footed shot landed under the crossbar.\n\nSu\u00e1rez then fed a charging Messi with a touch pass to beat New York goalkeeper Carlos Coronel with a shot from 15 yards.\n\nRojas made it 3-1 with his second goal in the 62nd minute on an assist from Messi.\n\nMessi then contributed on former Barcelona teammate Su\u00e1rez's first goal in the 69th minute.\n\nSu\u00e1rez also struck in the 75th and 81st minutes before the Red Bulls (4-2-5, 17 points) closed the scoring on Emil Forsberg's penalty kick in stoppage time.\n\nNew York controlled possession early and eventually capitalized on a Miami defensive breakdown that resulted on Dante Vanzeir's goal in the 30th minute. Jos\u00e9 Carmona ran deep into the right wing of the large area and blasted a shot that bounced off the far post. An unmarked Vanzeir retrieved the deflection and converted from 15 yards.\n\nMessi had his only scoring opportunity of the first half in the 24th minute, when Coronel stopped his shot from the edge of the penalty area.\n\nMessi's former Barcelona teammate Jordi Alba missed his third straight game because of a hamstring injury.\n\nBoth clubs will continue MLS play next Saturday. It was New York RB who scored and took a 1-0 lead in the match but it was Lionel Messi who took over the match. Messi assisted Matias Rojas for the first goal which drew Inter Miami level.\n\nThe 36 year old gave Inter Miami the 2-1 lead when the ball fell to him inside the penalty area and his effort found the back of the goal for Inter Miami's second goal of the match. Inter Miami's third goal was arguably Messi's best assist of the night.\n\nHe would play a pass in which would cut through New York's back line and it fell to Rojas once more and he would score his second goal of the match. His next three were for Luis Suarez, the first a low cross, the second was a play between the two players and the third was an outside of the foot pass.\n\nThe Argentine became the first player in MLS history to have five assists in one match and is the first player in the MLS this season to reach 10 goals. An unmarked Vanzeir retrieved the deflection and converted from 15 yards.\n\nMessi had his only scoring opportunity of the first half in the 24th minute, when Coronel stopped his shot from the edge of the penalty area.\n\nMessi\u00b4s former Barcelona teammate Jordi Alba missed his third straight game because of a hamstring injury.\n\nMessi also notched assists for a Matias Rojas brace during the Herons' thumping victory\n\nRojas' left-footed shot landed under the crossbar for the equalizer minutes after the break\n\nThe loss snapped New York's six-match unbeaten streak. {"uri": "8112589944", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "16:52:26", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T16:52:26Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T16:52:00Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7568627595901489, "url": "https://www.sportsmole.co.uk/football/inter-miami/news/messi-achieves-record-breaking-career-first-in-inter-miami-rout_542992.html", "title": "Messi achieves record-breaking career first in Inter Miami rout", "body": "Inter Miami forward Lionel Messi produces a record-breaking performance in Saturday's 6-2 win against New York Red Bulls. Lionel Messi enjoyed a record-breaking night in Inter Miami's 6-2 win over New York Red Bulls.\n\nDespite falling behind in the 30th minute, the hosts managed to claim a comfortable victory in Saturday's clash at Chase Stadium.\n\nMessi teed up Matias Rojas for Inter Miami's 48th-minute equaliser, before he put his own name on the scoresheet to turn the game in the home side's favour.\n\nThe Argentine produced an exquisite through ball to present Rojas with the chance to slot home Inter Miami's third goal of the evening.\n\nMessi then rolled back the years to link up with his former Barcelona teammate Luis Suarez, providing all three assists in the Uruguayan's 13-minute hat-trick.\n\nMessi makes history\n\nFormer RB Leipzig attacker Emil Forsberg netted a late consolation for the visitors, but his penalty could not detract from a record-breaking night for Messi.\n\nAfter being involved in all six of Inter Miami's goals, Messi registered six goal contributions in a game for the first time for club or country.\n\nThe 2022 World Cup winner also provided five assists in a single match for the first time in his career, taking his total to 12 goals and 11 assists in 11 competitive appearances for the season.\n\nThe Argentina international has now racked up 23 goals and 16 assists in 25 matches since he joined the American club last summer.\n\n\u00a9 Reuters\n\nInter Miami leading the way\n\nLike Messi, Suarez also enjoyed a memorable night, registering his 31st career hat-trick and his first three-goal haul since arriving from Gremio earlier this year.\n\nThe Uruguayan forward has scored 12 goals and contributed seven assists in his 15 competitive matches for Tata Martino's side.\n\nAs a result of Messi and Suarez's exploits, Inter Miami have registered 32 goals in 12 MLS games - 12 more than the next-best tally of the Portland Timbers.\n\nThose goals have helped Inter Miami collect 24 points to leave them at the top of the Eastern Conference with a three-point advantage over FC Cincinnati.\n\nInter Miami will return to action next Saturday when they travel to Canada for a clash with Montreal at Stade {"uri": "8108435654", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-02", "time": "18:24:55", "dateTime": "2024-05-02T18:24:55Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-02T18:24:35Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7568627595901489, "url": "https://www.amny.com/sports/red-bulls-messi-preview-5-2-24/", "title": "Red Bulls not lost in fanfare this time around vs. Messi, Inter Miami | amNewYork", "body": "Perhaps the novelty or awe inspired by the presence of Lionel Messi is wearing off for the New York Red Bulls as they prepare to take on Inter Miami on Saturday down in Fort Lauderdale, FL.\n\n\"Of course, playing against Messi is special, but... it's just a normal game,\" Red Bulls forward Dante Vanzeir said. \"It's a tough opponent. It's not only Messi, they have a lot of big guys running around.\"\n\nJust last summer when the legendary Argentinian talisman made his Major League Soccer debut with Inter Miami against the Red Bulls in Harrison, NJ, the talk was understandably centered around the disbelief of playing against the eight-time Ballon d'Or winner, who at the time was just eight months removed from winning the World Cup.\n\nIt showed during his 30 minutes on the pitch when he came on as a second-half sub. The Red Bulls were caught ball-watching, practically star-struck, as Messi received the ball in the middle of the box in the 89th minute. He threaded a pass to the right wing to Benjamin Cremaschi, who instantly played it back to the middle where Messi's unmarkable run found him all alone with nothing but an open net in front of him leaving Red Bulls keeper Carlos Coronel without a prayer.\n\nMore than eight months have passed since Inter Miami's 2-0 win over New York and with it comes a significantly different looking side.\n\n\"It's a big challenge for us,\" head coach Sandro Schwarz said on Thursday. \"Our preparation the whole week and our training session and our video meetings the whole week was that we are playing against Inter Miami. Not only against Messi.\"\n\nIn his first year as head coach, Schwarz has the Red Bulls -- who clawed their way into the postseason during the final week of the 2023 season -- in third place in the Eastern Conference 10 matches into this year. Lewis Morgan is healthy and scoring at will. Emil Forsberg is pulling the strings just as the savvy Bundesliga veteran was expected to when he signed in December. Vanzeir is hitting new heights in his second year with the club, which included four assists during a 4-0 win over a Messi-less Inter Miami on March 23.\n\nSaturday, however, provides a rematch between first-place Miami and the Red Bulls where Messi is healthy and expectedly clicking on all cylinders. He has scored in each of the last six MLS matches he has played in for nine goals in total including two in each of his last wo matches against Nashville and New England.\n\nAn imposing figure to line up against, obviously, especially when he has brought some of the other great European champions to Miami like Luis Suarez, Sergio Bousquets, and Jordi Alba. But this is something that has not sidetracking the Red Bulls during their preparations this week as it might have one year ago.\n\n\"I think the team is more relaxed,\" Vanzeir said on Thursday. \"We're not as surprised about the names that play there. We know their qualities in general and I think we're more mature and confident in ourselves. I think our focus is more on ourselves this week -- how we can make them hurt, how we can show our qualities.\"\n\nThat does not mean they have not spent significant time gameplanning for one of the greatest players the game has ever seen.\n\n\"It's a team with high quality, especially with Lionel Messi... so we have to defend very strong, very compact in our defense's line,\" Schwarz said. \"Our structure will be very important but it's necessary to have the confidence with the ball to find the solutions, to find the space... We know for sure [Messi] is a very important player for them, especially in their last third and in the half space with his left foot when he comes inside to the box, the cutbacks... it's an important topic for Saturday to defend against this issue but it's necessary that we have the confidence with the ball and not only to think about, 'OK, how do we defend against Messi?' because they have Suarez and [Robert] Taylor, a lot of good players.\"\n\nBetween Miami's embarrassment of attacking riches, they lead MLS with 26 goals scored this season. Only two other teams in the 29-team MLS has scored 20 or more times.\n\nThe Red Bulls are not one of them, but their 14 goals are tied for third most in the Eastern Conference while their 10 goals allowed is second-fewest. It is the byproduct of a possession-laden, pressing style of soccer bolstered by a stout defense -- and something they believe can derail the Miami machine this weekend.\n\n\"We're the strongest in our style of play,\" Vanzeir said. \"We know we can hurt a lot of teams and that's what we're going to do. At the end of the day, you give everything on that pitch in our style of play. If we win, great. If we lose they were just better. That's the kind of focus and confidence we have now.\"", "source": {"uri": "amny.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "amNewYork"}, "authors": [{"uri": "joe_pantorno@amny.com", "name": "Joe Pantorno", especially in the last third.\"\n\nSchwarz says he wants his team to play with the same sense of confidence that characterized their rout of Miami in March.\n\n\"It's an important topic to defend against (Messi), but it's also important that we have confidence with the ball, and that we're not thinking only about how to defend against Messi, because they have a lot of good players.\n\n\"We
