{"uri": "2024-05-345542755", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "11:11:17", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T11:11:17Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T03:09:43Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7450980544090271, "url": "https://www.kulr8.com/news/national/five-assists-and-goal-for-messi-hat-trick-for-suarez-as-miami-hit-six/article_1edb08bd-3478-5a7b-9d98-629626bc788f.html", "title": "Five assists and goal for Messi, hat-trick for Suarez as Miami hit six", "body": "Luis Suarez scored a hat-trick and Lionel Messi had an incredible five assists and a goal in the second half as a rampant Inter Miami crushed the New York Red Bulls 6-2 in Major League Soccer on Saturday.\n\nTwo-goal substitute Matias Rojas sparked the second half rout from Eastern Conference leaders Inter after New York had led 1-0 at the break.\n\nWithout Messi, Miami had fallen to a 4-0 defeat to the Red Bulls in New York in March, but they more than avenged that loss with a merciless second-half demolition job.\n\nMessi's five assists, which all came in the second half, are a new record for an MLS game and he now has 10 goals and 12 assists in eight league appearances so far this season.\n\nOperating behind Suarez, Messi's passing through the slightest of gaps, taking advantage of his former Barcelona teammate's telepathic understanding of his intentions, was simply too much for the Red Bulls, who came into the game third in the East.\n\n\"Obviously what we have seen today surprises people, because you don't see that in football,\" said Suarez of Messi's five assists.\n\n\"But as a teammate and someone who knows him, nothing surprises me about him,\" added the Uruguayan.\n\nThe 37-year-old Suarez's triples takes his own tally to 10 in 11 league games for Miami and despite no longer being blessed with pace, his deadly finishing clearly remains intact.\n\nWhile it was the kind of attacking display that Miami owners Jorge Mas and David Beckham surely dreamed of when they brought in the star pairing, there was no sign of the explosiveness in the opening half.\n\nDante Vanzeir had put the Red Bulls ahead in the 30th minute, slotting home after Wikelman Carmona's shot came out off the post, following a superb through pass from Swedish playmaker Emil Forsberg.\n\nGerardo Martino's Inter lacked intensity and ideas in the opening 45 minutes but the coach's half-time change transformed the game.\n\nParaguayan Rojas was introduced for the second half and took just three minutes to make an impact, collecting a pass from Messi and evading two defenders before unleashing an unstoppable drive from 25 yards out.\n\nMessi then put Miami in front when Rojas robbed Carmona and found Suarez, who slipped the ball to the Argentine, who made no mistake.\n\nThe eight-time Ballon d'Or winner then turned provider again as he split the New York defense with a brilliant through ball to Rojas, who deftly chipped over the advancing Carlos Coronel.\n\nSuarez's hat trick then came in the space of 12 minutes -- he first found the target when Messi chipped in a ball from the right and the Uruguayan hooked home a volley.\n\nIt was playground stuff minutes later when Suarez played a one-two with Messi and then poked home to make it 5-1.\n\nMessi was yet again the creator for Miami's sixth, which Suarez turned in from close range from the tightest of angles.\n\n\"The partnership of him (Messi) and Luis (Suarez) in the second half worked very well, like in old times (...) They were very influential in the game,\" said Martino.\n\nNew York had a late consolation in the final seconds with a penalty from Forsberg.\n\nsev/js\n\nMore from this section\n\nWellVisor Partners That goal extended the Argentine's MLS goal streak to seven straight games, dating back to the 1-1 draw against the LA Galaxy way back in late February.\n\nHowever, it wasn't the goal that was the story of the match for Inter Miami and their 36-year-old superstar.\n\nAlongside his goal, Messi set an all-time MLS record by assisting five goals in one match, with Luis Suarez bagging a hat-trick and new signing Matias Rojas grabbing a brace.\n\nLionel Messi has exploded into the 2024 season with a bang, scoring in seven straight league games through April and May, while also leading the club into its first-ever continental appearance.\n\nWhile the CONCACAF Champions Cup journey ended in the quarterfinals at the hands of a quality Monterrey side, Inter Miami are in contention for the MLS title near the top of the Eastern Conference table.\n\nWhile Lionel Messi's goal-scoring ability is what makes him one of the greatest ever, his equally exquisite creativity adds massively to his superstar career.\n\nMessi set an MLS record for assists in a single league match by registering an incredible five assists in a 6-2 win over the New York Red Bulls on May 4, and of course he scored the other goal himself.\n\nSomething to note: Major League Soccer gives credit for second assists, which are not recognized globally as assists, and therefore are not noted here. For example, Leo Afonso's goal against the Colorado Rapids on April 6 is logged as an assist to Messi by MLS, even tho he passed it to David Ruiz who then registered the final pass.\n\nLionel Messi is in contention for the MLS lead in both goals and assists thanks to a monstrous start to the 2024 season.\n\nThe only reason he isn't far-and-away in front of the leaderboard is his two-week injury layoff through April, otherwise he would be well in the clear.\n\nLionel Messi has not yet played any games for Argentina in 2024.\n\nThe World Cup winning star was injured for Argentina's only games in 2024 thus far, suffering a hamstring injury while with Inter Miami that kept him out of March friendlies against El Salvador and Costa Rica.\n\nShould he prove fit enough to take the field, he {"uri": "8111772729", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "02:23:46", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T02:23:46Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T02:23:01Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7372549176216125, "url": "https://wsvn.com/sports/inter-miami-cf/messi-has-a-record-setting-game-with-a-goal-and-5-assists-in-inter-miamis-6-2-win-over-red-bulls/", "title": "Messi has a record-setting game with a goal and 5 assists in Inter Miami's 6-2 win over Red Bulls - WSVN 7News | Miami News, Weather, Sports | Fort Lauderdale", "body": "FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla. (AP) -- Lionel Messi had a record setting night for Inter Miami.\n\nHe scored a goal and had five assists as Inter Miami trounced the New York Red Bulls 6-2 on Saturday night -- with the Argentine great and eight-time Ballon d'Or winner as the game's best player setting no fewer than three Major League Soccer records in the effort.\n\nThe six goal contributions, five assists and five assists in a half were all MLS records.\n\nMessi, who earned the MLS Player of the Month Award for April, has now scored and assisted in six consecutive league matches.\n\nLuis Su\u00e1rez had three goals and Matias Rojas scored twice as Inter Miami got six unanswered goals to come back from a 1-0 deficit at halftime. Messi and Su\u00e1rez now have a league-leading 10 goals each, helping keep Inter Miami (7-2-3, 24 points) atop the Eastern Conference.\n\nThe win extended Miami's unbeaten string to six. The streak began after a 4-0 loss at New York on April 20, in which Messi did not play because of an injury.\n\nMiami began the rout with Rojas' equalizer in the 48th minute. Messi centered a pass to Rojas whose left-footed shot landed under the crossbar.\n\nSu\u00e1rez then fed a charging Messi with a touch pass to beat New York goalkeeper Carlos Coronel with a shot from 15 yards.\n\nRojas made it 3-1 with his second goal in the 62nd minute on an assist from Messi.\n\nMessi then contributed on former Barcelona teammate Su\u00e1rez's first goal in the 69th minute.\n\nSu\u00e1rez also struck in the 75th and 81st minutes before the Red Bulls (4-2-5, 17 points) closed the scoring on Emil Forsberg's penalty kick in stoppage time.\n\nNew York controlled possession early and eventually capitalized on a Miami defensive breakdown that resulted on Dante Vanzeir's goal in the 30th minute. Jos\u00e9 Carmona ran deep into the right wing of the large area and blasted a shot that bounced off the far post. An unmarked Vanzeir retrieved the deflection and converted from 15 yards.\n\nMessi had his only scoring opportunity of the first half in the 24th minute, when Coronel stopped his shot from the edge of the penalty area.\n\nMessi's former Barcelona teammate Jordi Alba missed his third straight game because of a hamstring injury.\n\nBoth clubs will continue MLS play next Saturday. Inter Miami will visit CF Montreal while the Red Bulls will host New England.\n\nCopyright 2024 The Associated Press. All rights reserved. It is some revenge for David Beckham's soccer team after the Red Bulls demolished Miami 4-0 in New Jersey in March.\n\nIt looked like history might repeat itself when Dante Vanzeir opened the scoring for the visitors on the half hour mark, with the Red Bulls taking a 1-0 lead into halftime. But whatever Tata Martino said at the interval had the desired effect.\n\nMatias Rojas levelled the score on minute 48 thanks to Messi, before the World Cup winner, thanks to link-up play with Suarez, then got one for himself to take the lead. From there, the floodgates opened.\n\nREAD MORE: Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney unveil masterplan to lure Taylor Swift to Wrexham\n\nREAD MORE: Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez have already equalled record set by David Beckham and Landon Donovan\n\nRojas got a second, again thanks to Messi, before Suarez netted a hat-trick. And the same man got the assists for all those goals too. It meant Messi walked away from the fixture with five assists, a feat that has never been achieved before in Major League Soccer.\n\nThe Red Bulls did score a consolation goal through an Emil Forsberg penalty in the 97th minute but it did little undo the damage caused by Messi, Suarez and Rojas. The win keeps Miami at the top of the league, three points ahead of FC Cincinnati who have a game in hand.\n\nMessi has now scored 10 goals and produced nine assists in just eight MLS games this season. After a rocky star to the campaign with injury, there is no doubting the Argentinian is back to his best.\n\nLionel Messi and Luis Suarez ran riot against the New York Red Bulls\n\nSpeaking after the game, coach Martino was almost at a loss for words to sum up his star forward. \"Well, I always say the same thing, it is redundant to talk about him because he always seems to do something new,\" he said. \"And well, if something was missing, it was this. To have an impact on the six goals a team scores, this is going to be difficult to see again.\"\n\nReflecting on his team's achievements, he added: \"All of them had a phenomenal impact in the match. But well, Leo has probably done something historic, which is five assists, one goal in the league.\n\n\"I can't forget Luis' three goals, Mati\u0301as' two goals. The first one by Matias was good, both were great,\" Martino said when asked about his favorite score from the match. For the technical gesture and Leo's pass, I'll take Luis' scissors kick (in the 68th minute). {"uri": "8112409825", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "13:50:41", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T13:50:41Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T13:50:17Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7333333492279053, "url": "https://www.espn.co.uk/football/story/_/id/40086828/lionel-messi-difference-maker-power-inter-miami-new-york-red-bulls", "title": "Messi proves difference-maker to power Miami past Red Bulls", "body": "MIAMI -- No one inside Chase Stadium on Saturday night could have predicted what was to come at half-time. Inter Miami CF were losing at home to New York Red Bulls as the teams came back out after the break. Forty-five minutes later and Lionel Messi had broken the MLS record for most goal contributions in a single match in a 6-2 victory.\n\nThe Argentine forward had already set up one goal for Mat\u00edas Rojas before he scored himself, and he then assisted another for Rojas and all three Luis Su\u00e1rez goals in spectacular fashion.\n\n- Stream on ESPN+: LaLiga, Bundesliga, more (U.S.)\n\nDante Vanzeir had opened the scoring for the Red Bulls, giving the Herons flashbacks of their dreadful first confrontation with New York this season when they lost 4-0 at the Red Bull Arena on March 23. Inter Miami had played through the International break and also missed several players through injury-induced absences.\n\nMessi missed the game with a hamstring injury, though he would have been away with Argentina if fit, watching from afar as Miami faced a difficult challenge.\n\nThe lack of offensive options forced Martino into a 5-3-2 lineup with Suarez and Leonardo Campana leading the attack. It only took the Red Bulls three minutes to score.\n\nVanzeir supplied Lewis Morgan with a through ball, inspiring the No. 9 to complete the right-footed strike from just outside the box into the lower left corner of the goal. Defender Tom\u00e1s Avil\u00e9s struggled.\n\nMorgan scored a hat trick, while Wikelman Carmona celebrated his first contribution of the season. The Herons concluded the night with seven shots, two on target, 70% possession and no goals. Miami was dumbfounded.\n\n\"There is not much to say, except that we were outmatched from start to finish,\" Martino said after that first meeting. \"When a team enters a game without the desire to win, without spirit, without competing, and the other side just wants to win the game, they are going to win it.\"\n\nSix weeks later, the first half gave the impression that the Red Bulls might just be Miami's kryptonite. Only this time around, Inter Miami boasted their not-so-secret weapon.\n\nAfter half-time, Messi returned to the pitch with vengeance. After just three minutes he quickly worked the ball on the right, finding a pocket of space to provide Rojas with the perfect pass to complete the left-footed strike.\n\nTwo minutes later, Messi found the back of the net himself with a shot into the net from the center of the box. The equalizer calmed Miami's nerves and frazzled the opponent. The rainstorm of goals persisted until Suarez completed his first MLS hat trick.\n\n\"It's easier with Leo,\" Suarez said. \"Obviously we know each other, and sometimes you'll notice we know where the other is and do movements without having to look at one another. It's good for the team.\".\n\nMessi and Su\u00e1rez now have a league-leading 10 goals each, and the Argentina star also leads MLS in assists with 12.\n\nHead coach Gerardo \"Tata\" Martino has been witness to many of Messi's phases, coaching him at Barcelona from 2013-14 and with Argentina from 2014 to 2016. He also faced the forward while coaching the Paraguayan and Mexican national teams.\n\nBut even after watching him for years, Martino emphasized the impactful performance against the Red Bulls will be difficult to witness again.\n\n\"Messi had exceptional games in Barcelona, during my time with him,\" Martino said. \"But I also remember a semifinal with Paraguay in the Copa America in Chile, where he didn't score a goal and he was still the best player on the field. In Barcelona, he had a game against Valencia where we were losing 2-0 and then won 3-2 with three goals from him.\n\n\"And there was another against Sevilla where we were losing 1-0 and then he scored three goals and we won 4-1. I always say this, and it's redundant at this point, but he always does something new. To have involvement in all six goals of a team's 6-2 is something that will be difficult to see again.\"\n\nAs so many predicted, Messi has become an integral part of Inter Miami's success.\n\n\"He's not the key component just because of this game,\" Martino concluded. \"He always is. Today, the association between Messi and Luis in the second half worked well, like old times. When they find each other, the team is able to back them up in the game, and when we find space, they are very influential in the game.\n\n\"There is a reason MLS has Designated Players, and he is ours. So, when he is missing, the team feels it.\"\n\nSince he made his debut in July 2023, Inter Miami is 2-4-6 (WDL) when he does not play and 15-7-3 when he is on the pitch across all competitions.", With those combined with his goal, Messi also set a league record for goal contributions in a single game with six. Seven players held the previous record of five, including current Columbus Crew midfielder Diego Rossi twice, once in 2018 and once in 2020, both with LAFC.\n\nMessi now has 10 goals and 12 assists in just eight games played this season. He became the first Inter Miami player to register double digits in both categories in a single season.\n\nMessi now has 11 goals and 14 assists in 14 MLS regular season games played since joining Inter Miami last summer.\n\nThe Red Bulls actually struck first in the game and held a 1-0 lead at halftime, but Miami came out at a different level in the second half and took the game over. Miami's new signing Matias Rojas scored twice, star forward Luis Suarez added a hat trick and Messi was at the center of it all.\n\nSuarez now has 10 goals and five assists on the season.\n\nThe win They really were very influential in the game.\"\n\nMessi became the first player in MLS history to provide five assists in a single match, taking his season tally to 10 goals and nine assists in eight MLS outings.\n\nThe other player to impress for Inter Miami was Paraguayan midfielder Matias Rojas, who scored twice and also showed a remarkable understanding with Messi.\n\n\"The truth is that everyone had a phenomenal impact in the game, but Leo probably did something historic with five assists and a goal,\" Martino said.\n\n\"I always say the same thing: it is redundant to talk about him [Messi] because it seems like he always does something new. Lionel Messi was at the heart of the rout, providing a record five assists and netting a goal himself as former Barcelona teammate, Luis Suarez, scored a hat-trick.\n\nAfter falling behind to Dante Vanzeir's opener for the Red Bulls, Inter trailed 1-0 at half-time. However, the introduction of a substitute, Matias Rojas, sparked an astonishing turnaround. Rojas equalised within three minutes of the restart before Messi put Inter 2-1 up. The Argentine maestro then teed up Rojas again as the Paraguayan made it 3-1.\n\nSuarez took over from there, volleying home from a Messi assist to make it 4-1. The Uruguayan striker then exchanged passes with Messi to poke home Inter's fifth. Messi's fifth assist created the sixth, with Suarez turning in from a tight angle. Emil Forsberg's late penalty was scant consolation for the Red Bulls.\n\n\"The partnership of him (Messi) and Luis (Suarez) in the second half worked very well, like in old times,\" said Inter coach Gerardo Martino. \"They were very influential in the game.\" For Suarez, Messi's performance came as no surprise: \"Obviously what we have seen today surprises people, because you don't see that in football. But as a teammate and someone who knows him, nothing surprises me about him.\"\n\nThe rampant victory saw Messi take his tallies to 10 goals and 12 assists in just eight MLS appearances this season. For 37-year-old Suarez, his hat-trick took his league tally to 10 goals in 11 games as the former Barcelona stars continue to shine in Miami.", "source": {"uri": "thewillnews.com", "dataType": "news", While questions still remain about their viability without the Argentine great, Tata Martino hopes his side won't have to answer those for much of this year.\n\nMessi leads MLS this year in goals and is tied for the lead in assists, and his efforts to carry Inter Miami on his back have the club first in the Eastern Conference with 21 points from 11 games, although they've played one more match than nearly everyone else.\n\nThe Red Bulls sit third in the East, four points behind Inter Miami with a game in hand, meaning they are right in the thick of the battle. They have fallen off the pace slightly thanks to two straight draws but have lost just one match all season, which keeps them firmly in the hunt.\n\nThe Sporting News is following the Inter Miami vs New York Red Bulls match live, providing score updates, commentary and highlights as they happen.\n\nMORE: See the full updated MLS top goal scorers list as Lionel Messi leads the Golden Boot rankings\n\nInter Miami (4-3-3, right to left): Callender (GK) -- Weigandt, Freire, Aviles, Alba -- D. Messi now has 723 non-penalty goals in his career, while Ronaldo has 721. Messi has also achieved his total in 161 fewer games, which tracks as he is two years younger.\n\nRonaldo has always been his team's penalty taker throughout his career for club and country, while Messi has had less success from the spot, so it makes sense that he would do more of his damage from other situations.\n\nThere are two big questions for Tata Martino ahead of this match regarding his squad's availability. First, Jordi Alba has missed the last two games with a hamstring injury, and the timeline for his return is still unclear. It's thought he could potentially be back here as he was held out last week largely due to the Gillette Stadium field surface being turf, but with this game at home he could return.\n\nAdditionally, Luis Suarez came off the bench against the New England Revolution last weekend, amidst a chronic knee issue that needs consistent management, so it remains to be seen whether he is fit enough to start this game or if he needs more care.\n\nOtherwise, Inter Miami are beginning to get healthier each week. Diego Gomez is down for another few weeks with an ankle injury, while Serhiy Kryvtsov remains absent with a hamstring injury and Federico Redondo is down with a knee problem. Otherwise, there's only the long-term absence of ACL victim Facundo Farias to worry about, and things look far more promising than they did a few weeks ago.\n\nInter Miami projected starting lineup (4-3-3): Callender (GK) -- Weigandt, Freire, Aviles, Alba -- D. Otherwise, the absentee list for the Supporters' Shield contenders is minimal.\n\nPeter Stroud is down for a few weeks due to an ankle injury. {"uri": "8112007422", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "07:22:19", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T07:22:19Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T07:21:42Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.729411780834198, "url": "https://www.givemesport.com/lionel-messi-scores-assists-five-goals-inter-miami-6-2-new-york-red-bulls/", "title": "Lionel Messi plays jaw-dropping pass to assist teammate in Inter Miami 6-2 New York Red Bulls", "body": "Highlights Lionel Messi made MLS history by assisting five goals and scoring one in Inter Miami's win against New York Red Bulls. Messi's six goal contributions for Miami means that he is the first player to exceed 1200 career goal contributions. Miami now sits at the top of the MLS table after Messi's stellar performance, with a trip to Montreal next on their agenda.\n\nLionel Messi created MLS history during Inter Miami's 6-2 victory against New York Red Bulls, as the Argentine ran the show during their comfortable win. The eight-time Ballon d'Or winner assisted five of the goals and also got on the scoresheet himself.\n\nSince moving to America in 2023, Messi has continued to wow fans like he has done for Barcelona, Paris Saint-Germain and Argentina over the years. Nearly securing a play-off place for Miami despite their dismal start to the 2023 season, he has been in fine form once again for the 2024 MLS term, weighing in with 10 goals before their match against New York Red Bulls.\n\nAnd he continued that form in their most recent match. New York took the lead on the half-hour mark through Dante Vanzeir, but Messi emerged for the second-half with steely determination. He assisted Matias Rojas just three minutes after half-time, before putting Miami in front with a goal of his own two minutes later.\n\nMessi's Incredible Assist for Miami's Third Goal Argentine's precise pass goes viral\n\nHowever, Messi then stole the show with an incredible assist for Miami's third of the night. Playing a reverse pass to Rojas just inside New York's half, he then received the ball back and slowed play down with his first touch.\n\nSpotting Rojas making a run into the box, the Argentine threaded through an eye-of-the-needle pass to find the second half substitute. The ball was inch-perfect, perfectly weighted for the midfielder, who made the most of the opportunity. Football fans who have watched Messi over the years will have seen him create some goals with incredible skill, a mazy dribble, or an exquisite pass over the years, but this is up there with his best work.\n\nMessi Creates History as he Bags Five Assists Argentine the first MLS player ever to assist five times in a game\n\nHowever, that was not the end of what proved to be a fantastic night for Messi. He would go on to assist Luis Suarez three times, ensuring that the Uruguayan bagged a hat-trick on the night against New York.\n\nHaving a hand in every goal for Miami, Messi's five goal creations meant that he became the first player in MLS history to chalk up five assists in a single game. Impressively, he managed them all in the second half, a testament to just how good he was on the night.\n\nBut there was wider significance too. Messi's six goal contributions took him beyond the 1200 mark, making him the first player to exceed the landmark. After the career he has had so far, his latest accomplishment only helps to solidify his status as one of the best footballers of all time.\n\nWhat Next For Inter Miami and Messi Win cements position at the top of MLS table\n\nMessi's incredible showing against New York means that Miami are clear at the top of the MLS table, three points ahead of Salt Lake and Cincinnati, who both have games in hand. With 32 goals scored so far, though, there are few teams in the division who can boast the firepower at their disposal.\n\nUp next following their resounding victory is a trip to Montreal on 12th May, with Messi and Co hoping to continue their fine form. The Canadian outfit are currently 20th in the division with just 12 points from 10 games, so Miami will be confident of yet another victory.", "source": {"uri": "givemesport.com", "dataType": "news", {"uri": "8111979845", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "06:55:10", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T06:55:10Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T06:54:16Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7254902124404907, "url": "https://www.nairaland.com/8082399/inter-miamis-lionel-messi-sets", "title": "Inter Miami's Lionel Messi Sets Two Records In 5-Assist Game", "body": "Lionel Messi set the Major League Soccer record for most goal contributions and assists in a single match during Inter Miami CF's triumphant 6-2 victory over the New York Red Bulls on Saturday night at Chase Stadium in Fort Lauderdale, Florida.\n\nMessi's six goal contributions and five assists in a game set MLS records. He has now scored and assisted in six consecutive league matches.\n\n\"All [goals] were fundamental to the game, but Leo did something historic tonight with five assists and one goal,\" Inter Miami coach Gerardo \"Tata\" Martino said.\n\n\"But I can't forget Suarez's three goals and Rojas' two goals. The first, well both, but the first Rojas goal was amazing. But because of the technical aspect of Leo on the assist I will choose Luis Su\u00e1rez's scissor goal as my favorite.\"\n\nSu\u00e1rez had three goals and Mat\u00edas Rojas scored twice as Inter Miami got six unanswered goals to come back from a 1-0 deficit at halftime.\n\nMessi and Su\u00e1rez now have a league-leading 10 goals each, and the Argentina star also leads MLS in assists with 12.\n\n\"It's easier with Leo. Obviously we know each other, and sometimes you'll notice we know where the other is and do movements without having to look at one another. It's good for the team,\" Su\u00e1rez said.\n\nMartino and Messi boast a long history together, coinciding at Barcelona and playing against each other while the Herons coach led the national teams of Paraguay and Mexico. Even with years of experience watching Messi, Martino maintains the forward's performance against the Red Bulls will be difficult to witness again.\n\n\"Messi had exceptional games in Barcelona, during my time with him,\" he said. \"But I also remember a semifinal with Paraguay in the Copa America in Chile, where he didn't score a goal and he was still the best player on the field. In Barcelona, he had a game against Valencia where we were losing 2-0 and then won 3-2 with three goals from him. And there was another against Sevilla where we were losing 1-0 and then he scored three goals and we won 4-1. I always say this, and it's redundant at this point, but he always does something new. To have involvement in all six goals of a team's 6-2 is something that will be difficult to see again.\"\n\nMessi has quickly become an integral part of Inter Miami's success. Since he debuted with the Herons in July 2023, Inter Miami is 2-4-6 (WDL) when he does not play and 15-7-3 when he is on the pitch across all competitions.\n\n\"He's not the key component just because of this game. He always is. Today, the association between Messi and Luis in the second half worked well, like old times. When they find each other, the team is able to back them up in the game, and when we find space, they are very influential in the game,\" Martino added.\n\nMiami continues to lead the Eastern Shockingly enough, all five occurred in the second half which set a new league record for assists in a half as well.\n\nThe 36-year-old maintained a strong connection with former FC Barcelona teammate Luis Su\u00e1rez, as the Uruguayan finished the night with a hat-trick. All three of his goals were assisted by Messi.\n\nMessi wasn't done breaking records just yet, as he scored a goal of his own in the 50th minute. The Barcelona connection remained strong, as Su\u00e1rez assisted on the goal. With six total goal contributions in a single game, Messi set a new MLS record.\n\nThe Red Bulls jumped out to an early 1-0 advantage, although Inter Miami responded with six unanswered goals across a 33-minute span in the second half. While New York tacked on one final goal after the 90th minute, the result was still a lopsided Miami win.\n\nMessi has now recorded 10 goals and 12 assists in eight appearances this year, becoming the first Inter Miami player to record double-digit totals in both categories during a single season (h/t Paul Tenorio of The Athletic).\n\nHe's continued to set MLS records throughout the 2024 season, as he became the first player in league history to record five consecutive games with multiple goal contributions during an April 27 victory over the New England Revolution.\n\nAfter Saturday's action, {"uri": "8111943103", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "06:15:07", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T06:15:07Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T06:13:48Z", "dataType": "news", "Five Assists and Goal for Lionel Messi, Hat-trick for Luis Suarez as Inter Miami Thrash New York Red Bulls 6-2 - News18", "body": "Lionel Messi's five assists, which all came in the second half, are a new record for an MLS game and he now has 10 goals and 12 assists in eight league appearances so far this season.\n\nLuis Suarez scored a hat-trick and Lionel Messi had an incredible five assists and a goal in the second half as a rampant Inter Miami crushed the New York Red Bulls 6-2 in Major League Soccer on Saturday.\n\nTwo-goal substitute Matias Rojas sparked the second half rout from Eastern Conference leaders Inter after New York had led 1-0 at the break.\n\nWithout Messi, Miami had fallen to a 4-0 defeat to the Red Bulls in New York in March, but they more than avenged that loss with a merciless second-half demolition job.\n\nMessi's five assists, which all came in the second half, are a new record for an MLS game and he now has 10 goals and 12 assists in eight league appearances so far this season.\n\nOperating behind Suarez, Messi's passing through the slightest of gaps, taking advantage of his former Barcelona teammate's telepathic understanding of his intentions, was simply too much for the Red Bulls, who came into the game third in the East.\n\n\"Obviously what we have seen today surprises people, because you don't see that in football,\" said Suarez of Messi's five assists.\n\n\"But as a teammate and someone who knows him, nothing surprises me about him,\" added the Uruguayan.\n\nThe 37-year-old Suarez's triples takes his own tally to 10 in 11 league games for Miami and despite no longer being blessed with pace, his deadly finishing clearly remains intact.\n\nWhile it was the kind of attacking display that Miami owners Jorge Mas and David Beckham surely dreamed of when they brought in the star pairing, there was no sign of the explosiveness in the opening half.\n\nDante Vanzeir had put the Red Bulls ahead in the 30th minute, slotting home after Wikelman Carmona's shot came out off the post, following a superb through pass from Swedish playmaker Emil Forsberg.\n\nStay updated with the latest from IPL 2024, including top contenders for the IPL 2024 Orange Cap and IPL 2024 Purple Cap. Explore the complete IPL 2024 Schedule, IPL 2024 Points Table and players with the Most Sixes, Most Fours and Most Fifties in IPL 2024\n\nGerardo Martino's Inter lacked intensity and ideas in the opening 45 minutes but the coach's half-time change transformed the game.\n\nParaguayan Rojas was introduced for the second half and took just three minutes to make an impact, collecting a pass from Messi and evading two defenders before unleashing an unstoppable drive from 25 yards out.\n\nMessi then put Miami in front when Rojas robbed Carmona and found Suarez, who slipped the ball to the Argentine, who made no mistake.\n\nThe eight-time Ballon d'Or winner then turned provider again as he split the New York defense with a brilliant through ball to Rojas, who deftly chipped over the advancing Carlos Coronel.\n\nSuarez's hat trick then came in the space of 12 minutes -- he first found the target when Messi chipped in a ball from the right and the Uruguayan hooked home a volley.\n\nIt was playground stuff minutes later when Suarez played a one-two with Messi and then poked home to make it 5-1.\n\nMessi was yet again the creator for Miami's sixth, which Suarez turned in from close range from the tightest of angles.\n\n\"The partnership of him (Messi) and Luis (Suarez) in the second half worked very well, like in old times (...) They were very influential in the game,\" said Martino.\n\nNew York had a late consolation in the final seconds with a penalty from Forsberg.", "source": {"uri": "news18.com", "dataType": "news", It's good for the team,\" Suarez said.\n\nMartino and Messi boast a long history together, coinciding at Barcelona and playing against each other while the Herons coach led Paraguay and Mexico national teams. Even with years of experience watching Messi, Martino maintains the forward's performance against the Red Bulls will be difficult to witness again.\n\n\"Messi had exceptional games in Barcelona, during my time with him. But I also remember a semifinal with Paraguay in the Copa America in Chile, where he didn't score a goal and he was still the best player on the field. In Barcelona, he had a game against Valencia where we were losing 2-0 and then won 3-2 with three goals from him. And there was another against Sevilla where we were losing 1-0 and then he scored three goals and we won 4-1. I always say this, and it's redundant at this point, but he always does something new. To have involvement in all six goals of a team's 6-2 is something that will be difficult to see again.\"\n\nMessi has quickly become an integral part of Inter Miami's success. Since he debuted with the Herons in July 2023, Inter Miami is 2-4-6 (WDL) when he does not play and 15-7-3 when he is on the pitch across all competitions.\n\n\"He's not the key component just because of this game. He always is. Today, the association between Messi and Luis in the second half worked well, like old times. When they find each other, the team is able to back them up in the game and when we find space, they are very influential in the game,\" Martino added.\n\nMiami continues to lead the Eastern He participated in six goals - I don't think we will ever see anything like that again.\"\n\n\"Today Luis' connection [with Messi] was very good. Like the old days,\" added Martino.\n\nEmil Forsberg, who scored a late penalty for the New York Red Bulls, was furious at the collapse, even if found it in himself to praise Messi's skill.\n\n\"The feelings in the locker room, the reactions were of course not good.\n\n\"I think we're very disappointed about the second half.\n\n\"I think we played a perfect first half, we did very well,\" Forsberg said.\n\n\"I think we're always coming in confident in the games. We're playing good. We're doing what we're saying we're going to do. We need to step up next weekend and be better than the second half.\n\n\"I mean, we can't accept this. {"uri": "8111806069", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "03:17:02", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T03:17:02Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T03:16:12Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7137255072593689, "url": "https://www.bostonglobe.com/2024/05/04/sports/lionel-messi-records/", "title": "All hail Lionel Messi, who set three Major League Soccer records in Inter Miami rout - The Boston Globe", "body": "The six goal contributions, five assists, and five assists in a half were all MLS records.\n\nMessi, who earned the MLS Player of the Month Award for April, has now scored and assisted in six consecutive league matches.\n\nLuis Su\u00e1rez had three goals and Matias Rojas scored twice as Inter Miami got six unanswered goals to come back from a 1-0 deficit at halftime. Messi and Su\u00e1rez now have a league-leading 10 goals each, helping keep Inter Miami (7-2-3, 24 points) atop the Eastern Conference.\n\nThe win extended Miami's unbeaten string to six. The streak began after a 4-0 loss at New York on April 20, in which Messi did not play because of an injury.\n\nMiami began the rout with Rojas' equalizer in the 48th minute. Messi centered a pass to Rojas, whose left-footed shot landed under the crossbar.\n\nSu\u00e1rez then fed a charging Messi with a touch pass to beat New York goalkeeper Carlos Coronel with a shot from 15 yards.\n\nRojas made it 3-1 with his second goal in the 62d minute on an assist from Messi.\n\nMessi then contributed on former Barcelona teammate Su\u00e1rez's first goal in the 69th minute.\n\nSu\u00e1rez also struck in the 75th and 81st minutes before the Red Bulls (4-2-5, 17 points) closed the scoring on Emil Forsberg's penalty kick in stoppage time.\n\nNew York controlled possession early and eventually capitalized on a Miami defensive breakdown that resulted on Dante Vanzeir's goal in the 30th minute. Jos\u00e9 Carmona ran deep into the right wing and blasted a shot that bounced off the far post. An unmarked Vanzeir retrieved the deflection and converted from 15 yards.\n\nMessi had his only scoring opportunity of the first half in the 24th minute, when Coronel stopped his shot from the edge of Bulls", "body": "WASHINGTON, May 5, (Xinhua): Lionel Messi set a new Major League Soccer record of five assists in a single match as leaders Inter Miami romped to a 6-1 home win over New York Red Bulls on Saturday.\n\nLuis Suarez's hat-trick was relegated to a support act as Messi, who also scored a goal, continued his outstanding run of form for the Florida outfit.\n\nNew York went ahead on the half-hour at Chase stadium through Dante Vanzeir, who thumped home a first-time effort after Wikelman Carmon's shot cannoned off the far post.\n\nMatias Rojas put Inter Miami on level terms by receiving Messi's pass before curling a 20-yard effort into the top-right corner.\n\nRojas and Suarez then linked up before the latter's deft pass released Messi, who gave his side the lead by firing home from 12 yards.\n\nInter Miami extended their advantage just after the hour through the impressive Rojas, who ran onto Messi's sublime through ball and sent a delightful chip over the head of goalkeeper Carlos Coronel.\n\nThe almost telepathic understanding between Messi and Suarez was on display as the Uruguayan striker sent an acrobatic volley into the far corner after the Inter Miami captain's lofted cross.\n\nThe former Barcelona teammates were irrepressible and they again exchanged a series of slick passes before Suarez stroked home his side's fifth goal.\n\nSuarez, who joined Inter Miami on a free transfer in January, added to New York's misery by running onto Messi's pass and rounding Coronel before threading home his third goal from the tightest of angles.\n\nThe visitors grabbed a late consolation goal when Emil Forsberg converted from the spot after Marcelo Weigandt's mistimed challenge on John Tolkin.\n\nThe result leaves Inter Miami three points clear of second-placed Cincinnati in the Eastern Conference standings while New York Red Bulls remain fourth with 17 points.\n\nMessi has now scored 12 goals and provided 11 assists in 11 games for Inter Miami this season while Suarez has 12 goals and seven assists in 15 outings. {"uri": "8111788089", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "02:55:54", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T02:55:54Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T02:49:24Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7137255072593689, "url": "https://gazette.com/ap/messi-goal-and-five-assists-suarez-hat-trick-rojas-brace-inter-miami-beats-red-bulls/article_0d61398f-e516-51f6-bbc6-438d6427cb6f.html", "title": "Messi goal and five assists, Suarez hat trick, Rojas brace! Inter Miami beats Red Bulls, 6-2.", "body": "FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla. -- This time, Lionel Messi was in the Inter Miami starting lineup against the New York Red Bulls and he made a massive difference.\n\nWith Miami trailing 1-0 at halftime on Saturday night, the Argentine captain delivered a goal and five assists (yes, five!) and led the team to an emphatic 6-2 victory. Newly signed Paraguayan midfielder Matias Rojas, a second-half sub, scored two goals. Luis Suarez got a hat trick over the span of 12 minutes. All of Miami's goals were scored after halftime.\n\nSix weeks ago, Inter Miami was trounced, 4-0, on the road to the Red Bulls for their worst loss of the season.\n\nWhen the teams met at Red Bulls Arena on March 23, the weather was horrid, Messi was out with a hamstring injury. Saturday was a completely different climate and result.\n\nMessi has scored 10 goals and recorded 12 assists over eight games so far this season, an MLS record. His six goal contributions on Saturday set a record for the most in a single game in MLS history. Messi's five assists were also the most by a player in a game in MLS history.\n\nMiami has not lost another league game since that defeat to New York and is riding a four-game win streak during which it has outscored opponents 16-6.\n\nMessi is a big reason for the turnaround and for the team's surge to the top of the Supporters Shield race with 24 points. On Tuesday was named MLS Player of the Month for April, and he continues to shine in May.\n\nHe was coming off a two-goal, one-assist performance in a 4-1 win over the New England Revolution in front of a historic crowd of 65,600 at Gillette Stadium.\n\nMiami is unbeaten over the past four league games and leads MLS with 32 goals. Third-place New York was unbeaten over six, led by Emil Forsberg and Morgan, who has seven goals and one assist in 10 games.\n\nFeatured Local Savings\n\n\"We have recovered from a difficult, painful stretch,\" Martino said before the game Saturday. \"We aspired to be the Columbus of (Wednesday) night (the Crew beat Monterrey to advance to the Champions Cup final). We were unable to do that, but we regrouped with a road win at Kansas City and have had three wins now, including two on the road. That gives us strength. We are in a good stretch and want to keep it going.\"\n\nThe men in pink were determined to start strong on Saturday and avenge the loss to the Red Bulls.\n\n\"It's time for us to show them how good we really are,\" Taylor said. \"When we went there, we were not ourselves at all. Now it's redemption for us.\"\n\nThe rest of the Miami lineup Saturday was Drake Callender, Tomas Aviles, Nico Freire, Franco Negri, Sergio Busquets, Julian Gressel, David Ruiz, Marcelo Weigandt, Luis Suarez, and Robert Taylor. Callender, Freire, Negri, Ruiz, and Weigandt did not play in the game at New York.\n\nFormer Inter Miami player Lewis Morgan led the Red Bulls with a hat trick in their first meeting. He was held scoreless on Saturday.\n\n\"It was a poor game, we have analyzed it a lot, independent of the absences, and it was our worst match of the past year,\" said Inter Miami coach Tata Martino of the first matchup. \"We expect an equally intense game Saturday, they have all their players also available. It will be a good test for us.\"\n\nThey aced the test. And then some.\n\n\u00a92024 Miami Herald. Visit at miamiherald.com. Explore his impact with Luis Su\u00e1rez in the MLS record-setting match.\n\nLionel Messi made Major League Soccer history with a stellar performance, setting records for goal contributions and assists in a single match during Inter Miami CF's impressive 6-2 victory over the New York Red Bulls at Chase Stadium in Fort Lauderdale, Florida.\n\nInter Miami coach Gerardo \"Tata\" Martino hailed Messi's remarkable feat, emphasizing the significance of his contributions to the team's triumph. \"All [goals] were fundamental to the game, but Leo did something historic tonight with five assists and one goal,\" Martino said.\n\nHowever, Martino also highlighted the stellar performances of Luis Su\u00e1rez and Mat\u00edas Rojas, who played pivotal roles in the victory. Su\u00e1rez netted a hat-trick, while Rojas scored twice, contributing to Inter Miami's stunning comeback from a 1-0 deficit at halftime.\n\nWith Messi and Su\u00e1rez leading the charge, Inter Miami's attack has become formidable. Both players have reached double figures in goals for the season, with Messi also leading the league in assists with 12.\n\nSu\u00e1rez praised the understanding and chemistry he shares with Messi on the pitch, attributing their success to their longstanding partnership. \"It's easier with Leo. Obviously, we know each other, and sometimes you'll notice we know where the other is and do movements without having to look at one another. It's good for the team,\" Su\u00e1rez said.\n\nMartino's Recognition of Messi's Brilliance\n\nMartino, who has a long history with Messi dating back to their time at Barcelona, expressed awe at Messi's performance against the Red Bulls. Reflecting on their past experiences together, Martino acknowledged Messi's ability to amaze with his talent and versatility constantly.\n\n\"Messi had exceptional games in Barcelona during my time with him,\" Martino recalled. \"But I always say this, and it's redundant at this point, but he always does something new. To have involvement in all six goals of a team's 6-2 is something that will be difficult to see again.\"\n\nMessi's Impact on Inter Miami's Success\n\nSince joining Inter Miami in July 2023, Messi has become a linchpin of the team's success. His presence on the pitch significantly influences the team's performance, as evidenced by their impressive record with him in the lineup.\n\nMartino emphasized Messi's indispensable role in the team, highlighting his influence on the pitch and his positive impact on his teammates. \"He's not the key component just because of this game. He always is,\" Martino said.\n\nLooking Ahead\n\nWith Messi leading the charge, Inter Miami continues to lead the Eastern Conference table with 24 points in 12 games. As they aim for further success, Messi's brilliance remains a driving force behind their aspirations for MLS glory.\n\nAs Inter Miami gears up for future challenges, Messi's exceptional talent and leadership will be crucial in maintaining their momentum and achieving their goals. With his unmatched skills and unwavering commitment, Messi has firmly established himself as a cornerstone of Inter Miami's ambitions, inspiring his teammates to strive for excellence on the field.\n\nAs the MLS season progresses, all eyes will be on Messi and Inter Miami as they seek to build on their impressive start and make a lasting impact on the league. {"uri": "8111856876", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "04:28:33", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T04:28:33Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T04:27:36Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7098039388656616, "url": "https://www.bssnews.net/sports/187171", "title": "Five assists and goal for Messi, hat-trick for Suarez as Miami hit six | Sports", "body": "FORT LAUDERDALE, United States, May 5, 2024 (BSS/AFP) - Luis Suarez scored a hat-trick and Lionel Messi had an incredible five assists and a goal in the second half as a rampant Inter Miami crushed the New York Red Bulls 6-2 in Major League Soccer on Saturday.\n\nTwo-goal substitute Matias Rojas sparked the second half rout from Eastern Conference leaders Inter after New York had led 1-0 at the break.\n\nWithout Messi, Miami had fallen to a 4-0 defeat to the Red Bulls in New York in March, but they more than avenged that loss with a merciless second-half demolition job.\n\nMessi's five assists, which all came in the second half, are a new record for an MLS game and he now has 10 goals and 12 assists in eight league appearances so far this season.\n\nOperating behind Suarez, Messi's passing through the slightest of gaps, taking advantage of his former Barcelona teammate's telepathic understanding of his intentions, was simply too much for the Red Bulls, who came into the game third in the East.\n\n\"Obviously what we have seen today surprises people, because you don't see that in football,\" said Suarez of Messi's five assists.\n\n\"But as a teammate and someone who knows him, nothing surprises me about him,\" added the Uruguayan.\n\nThe 37-year-old Suarez's triples takes his own tally to 10 in 11 league games for Miami and despite no longer being blessed with pace, his deadly finishing clearly remains intact.\n\nWhile it was the kind of attacking display that Miami owners Jorge Mas and David Beckham surely dreamed of when they brought in the star pairing, there was no sign of the explosiveness in the opening half.\n\nDante Vanzeir had put the Red Bulls ahead in the 30th minute, slotting home after Wikelman Carmona's shot came out off the post, following a superb through pass from Swedish playmaker Emil Forsberg.\n\nGerardo Martino's Inter lacked intensity and ideas in the opening 45 minutes but the coach's half-time change transformed the game.\n\nParaguayan Rojas was introduced for the second half and took just three minutes to make an impact, collecting a pass from Messi and evading two defenders before unleashing an unstoppable drive from 25 yards out.\n\nMessi then put Miami in front when Rojas robbed Carmona and found Suarez, who slipped the ball to the Argentine, who made no mistake.\n\nThe eight-time Ballon d'Or winner then turned provider again as he split the New York defense with a brilliant through ball to Rojas, who deftly chipped over the advancing Carlos Coronel.\n\nSuarez's hat trick then came in the space of 12 minutes -- he first found the target when Messi chipped in a ball from the right and the Uruguayan hooked home a volley.\n\nIt was playground stuff minutes later when Suarez played a one-two with Messi and then poked home to make it 5-1.\n\nMessi was yet again the creator for Miami's sixth, which Suarez turned in from close range from the tightest of angles.\n\n\"The partnership of him (Messi) and Luis (Suarez) in the second half worked very well, like in old times (...) They were very influential in the game,\" said Martino.\n\nNew York had a late consolation in the final seconds with a penalty from Forsberg.", "source": {"uri": "bssnews.net", "dataType": "news", {"uri": "8112119084", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "09:13:09", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T09:13:09Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T09:12:41Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7058823704719543, "url": "https://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/lionel-messi-suarez-inter-miami-32738927", "title": "Messi creates history with five assists while Suarez bags Inter Miami hat-trick", "body": "Lionel Messi has made history in the MLS by becoming the first player to provide FIVE assists in a single game.\n\nThe amazing feat came as old Barcelona pal Luis Suarez also netted a first hat-trick for Inter Miami in their thrashing of New York Red Bulls. World Cup champion Messi, 36, was on top form, helping Inter Miami secure a 6-2 victory at Florida's Chase Stadium on Saturday evening. The win serves as sweet revenge for David Beckham's squad, who were previously crushed 4-0 by the Red Bulls in New Jersey back in March.\n\nThe match initially seemed to be heading towards a repeat of the previous encounter when Dante Vanzeir put the visitors ahead half an hour into the game. However, whatever Inter Miami manager Tata Martino said during half-time clearly worked wonders.\n\nREAD MORE: Will Ferrell 'buys large stake' in Leeds after 'falling in love' with English football\n\nREAD MORE: Meet Cristiano Ronaldo's biggest fan who mimics his life and gets mistaken for superstar\n\nThis article contains affiliate links, we will receive a commission on any sales we generate from it. Sky Sports is the only way to watch all the action this year.\n\n\u00a322 a month\n\nSky Get it here\n\nJust three minutes into the second half, Matias Rojas equalised thanks to Messi's assist, before the World Cup winner himself scored to give Miami the lead. From that point onwards, it was a goal fest.\n\nRojas bagged another goal, once again courtesy of Messi, before Suarez completed his hat-trick. Impressively, all these goals were assisted by Messi, marking a record-breaking performance in the MLS, reports the Mirror.\n\nDespite Emil Forsberg scoring a penalty for the Red Bulls in the 97th minute, it did little to mitigate the damage inflicted by the trio of Messi, Suarez and Rojas. The victory keeps Miami at the summit of the league, three points clear of FC Cincinnati, who have a game in hand.\n\nAfter a sluggish start due to injuries, Lionel Messi has now notched up 10 goals and provided 12 assists in just eight MLS matches this season proving he's back on top form. Martino, his coach, was left almost speechless when discussing the Argentine star's performance post-match. \"Well, I always say the same thing, it is redundant to talk about him because he always seems to do something new,\" he marvelled.\n\n\"And well, if something was missing, it was this. To have an impact on the six goals a team scores, this is going to be difficult to see again.\"\n\nReflecting further on his squad's accomplishment, Martino added: \"All of them had a phenomenal impact in the match. But well, Leo has probably done something historic, which is five assists, one goal in the league.\n\n\"I can't forget Luis' three goals, Matias' two goals. The first one by Matias was good, both were grea.\" When quizzed over his favourite goal from the game, he then declared: \"For the technical gesture and Leo's pass, I'll take Luis' scissors kick (in the 68th minute). {"uri": "8114129738", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "16:24:04", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T16:24:04Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T16:23:45Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6980392336845398, "url": "https://worldsoccertalk.com/news/how-close-is-messi-to-breaking-the-mls-goal-scoring-record/", "title": "How close is Messi to breaking the MLS goal-scoring record?", "body": "Even though the 2024 MLS season is roughly one-third of the way through, Lionel Messi is garnering discussion about breaking the MLS goal-scoring record. Lionel Messi's goal against the New York Red Bulls brought his total up to 10 on the season. Ironically, he is joined at the top of that chart by teammate Luis Suarez, who secured a hat trick against New York on Saturday.\n\nYes, it is still early in the 2024 MLS season. Yet, there is a chance Lionel Messi will usurp that single-season scoring record in Major League Soccer. Currently, the high mark belongs to Carlos Vela. The Mexican scored 34 goals in the 2019 MLS Season, doing so in 31 MLS games with LAFC. After 12 games in that season, Vela had 13 goals, so he was ahead of the pace Messi is currently on. However, the Argentine has missed four games. Effectively, he is on just over a goal-per-game ratio. In terms of numbers, Messi is scoring 1.25 goals per game, while Vela's record-breaking season was 1.1 goals per game. That is a slim, arguably marginal difference. However, the pace would be enough for Messi to break the record, assuming he plays enough games.\n\nIn that lies the challenge for Messi and Inter Miami this season. There are no guarantees surrounding how many games Lionel Messi will play in the pink kit of the Florida club. There are several arguments that say as soon as Inter Miami clinches a playoff spot, it should begin to cut Messi's minutes to ensure he is fit for the playoffs. He has already missed four games this season. Officially, one of those was for rest, but the other three that followed were connected to ever-present muscular problems.\n\nBased on his current ratio, Messi would need to play in 28 MLS games to break Vela's record and score 35 goals in one MLS season. That assumes he can maintain this remarkable pace, too. It will likely simmer down, but Carlos Vela was a consistent goal-scorer throughout the 2019 MLS campaign. Based on his early success, health may be Messi's biggest opponent in regard to the record.\n\nIf Lionel Messi does not break the goal-scoring record in MLS, there is still the potential for other records for Messi. For example, he is already setting the standard in MLS for the future. Through eight games this season, Messi broke several records, some of which were single-game records.\n\nLooking back to the 6-2 win over the New York Red Bulls, Messi set the single-game mark for both goal contributions and assists. His five-assist performance at the weekend was the most in MLS history. Combine those with his goal, and no other MLS player has contributed six goals in one game. It was also the sixth game in a row for Messi to amass multiple goal contributions. In his last four games, Messi has contributed 14 goals with the Argentine scoring six and assisting eight in that span.\n\nIn total, he has 22 goal contributions through eight games played in MLS. That is a record for eight games in MLS history, with Miami benefiting greatly. It leads the MLS Eastern Conference with 24 points through 12 games. Moreover, Miami is unbeaten when Messi plays in MLS this season.\n\nGoal contributions are hard to nail down. One assist may be far more impressive than another, much like some goals are penalties and some are world-class efforts. Regardless, MLS attributed five assists to Messi, and that put him atop the MLS assist chart. With 10 assists to go along with his 10 goals, Messi is on track to break the single-season assist record, too. Carlos Valderrama holds that record with 26 assists in 2000. Again, Messi's current pace would be enough to break that record. It simply comes down to how available Messi is with Inter Miami.", "source": {"uri": "worldsoccertalk.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "World Soccer Talk"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": "sim": 0.6980392336845398, "url": "https://www.urdupoint.com/en/world/five-assists-and-goal-for-messi-hat-trick-fo-1821677.html", "title": "Five Assists And Goal For Messi, Hat-trick For Suarez As Miami Hit Six - UrduPoint", "body": "Fort Lauderdale, (APP - UrduPoint / Pakistan Point News - 5th May, 2024) Luis Suarez scored a hat-trick and Lionel Messi had an incredible five assists and a goal in the second half as a rampant Inter Miami crushed the New York Red Bulls 6-2 in Major League Soccer on Saturday.\n\nMessi's five assists, which all came in the second half, are a new record for an MLS game and he now has 10 goals and 12 assists in eight league appearances so far this season.\n\nOperating behind Suarez, Messi's passing through the slightest of gaps, taking advantage of his former Barcelona teammate's telepathic understanding of his intentions, was simply too much for the Red Bulls, who came into the game third in the East.\n\n\"Obviously what we have seen today surprises people, because you don't see that in football,\" said Suarez of Messi's five assists.\n\n\"But as a teammate and someone who knows him, nothing surprises me about him,\" added the Uruguayan.\n\nThe 37-year-old Suarez's triples takes his own tally to 10 in 11 league games for Miami and despite no longer being blessed with pace, his deadly finishing clearly remains intact.\n\nWhile it was the kind of attacking display that Miami owners Jorge Mas and David Beckham surely dreamed of when they brought in the star pairing, there was no sign of the explosiveness in the opening half.\n\nDante Vanzeir had put the Red Bulls ahead in the 30th minute, slotting home after Wikelman Carmona's shot came out off the post, following a superb through pass from Swedish playmaker Emil Forsberg.\n\nGerardo Martino's Inter lacked intensity and ideas in the opening 45 minutes but the coach's half-time change transformed the game.\n\nParaguayan Rojas was introduced for the second half and took just three minutes to make an impact, collecting a pass from Messi and evading two defenders before unleashing an unstoppable drive from 25 yards out.\n\nMessi then put Miami in front when Rojas robbed Carmona and found Suarez, who slipped the ball to the Argentine, who made no mistake.\n\nThe eight-time Ballon d'Or winner then turned provider again as he split the New York defense with a brilliant through ball to Rojas, who deftly chipped over the advancing Carlos Coronel.\n\nSuarez's hat trick then came in the space of 12 minutes -- he first found the target when Messi chipped in a ball from the right and the Uruguayan hooked home a volley.\n\nIt was playground stuff minutes later when Suarez played a one-two with Messi and then poked home to make it 5-1.\n\nMessi was yet again the creator for Miami's sixth, which Suarez turned in from close range from the tightest of angles.\n\n\"The partnership of him (Messi) and Luis (Suarez) in the second half worked very well, like in old times (...) Instead, it is once again Lionel Messi dominating headlines courtesy of a performance which almost defied belief.\n\nIn a 6-2 victory over the New York Red Bulls, Messi broke two MLS records. \"I don't think we will ever see anything like that again,\" said Miami's head coach Gerardo \"Tata\" Martino, per the MLS.\n\nThe World Cup-winning Argentine became the first player in the league to make five assists in a single game, while his goal and assists made his six-goal contribution at Chase Stadium the most in a single game in the league's history.\n\nLast week, in Miami's victory over New England Revolution, Messi had set two other MLS records.\n\nHe has now scored and assisted in six consecutive league matches, taking his goal tally for the season to 10 in eight games - equal with Su\u00e1rez. No other player in the MLS has contributed more assists this season than Messi's 12.\n\nMessi and Su\u00e1rez formed a formidable partnership while at Barcelona and the pair have seamlessly transferred that understanding onto the pitch when playing for Miami.\n\nMiami went into half-time 1-0 down, with Dante Vanzeir putting New York ahead in the 30th minute. But after the break, substitute Mat\u00edas Rojas leveled in the 48th minute after being put through by Messi.\n\nMessi then put his team 2-1 ahead before turning provider for Su\u00e1rez on three occasions and again for new signing Rojas, who ended the match with two goals. Emil Forsberg scored in the 97th minute for a consolation goal.\n\nMiami remains top of the Eastern Conference and next plays CF Montreal on May 11.\n\nThe-CNN-Wire\n\n\u2122 & \u00a9 2024 Cable News Network, Inc., a Warner Bros. eight league appearances so far this season.\n\nLuis Suarez scored a hat-trick and Lionel Messi had an incredible five assists and a goal in the second half as a rampant Inter Miami crushed the New York Red Bulls 6-2 in Major League Soccer on Saturday.\n\nTwo-goal substitute Matias Rojas sparked the second half rout from Eastern Conference leaders Inter after New York had led 1-0 at the break.\n\nWithout Messi, Miami had fallen to a 4-0 defeat to the Red Bulls in New York in March, but they more than avenged that loss with a merciless second-half demolition job.\n\nMessi's five assists, which all came in the second half, are a new record for an MLS game and he now has 10 goals and 12 assists in eight league appearances so far this season.\n\nOperating behind Suarez, Messi's passing through the slightest of gaps, taking advantage of his former Barcelona teammate's telepathic understanding of his intentions, was simply too much for the Red Bulls, who came into the game third in the East.\n\n\"Obviously what we have seen today surprises people, because you don't see that in football,\" said Suarez of Messi's five assists. \"But as a teammate and someone who knows him, nothing surprises me about him,\" added the Uruguayan.\n\nThe 37-year-old Suarez's triples takes his own tally to 10 in 11 league games for Miami and despite no longer being blessed with pace, opening 45 minutes but the coach's half-time change transformed the game.\n\nParaguayan Rojas was introduced for the second half and took just three minutes to make an impact, collecting a pass from Messi and evading two defenders before unleashing an unstoppable drive from 25 yards out.\n\nMessi then put Miami in front when Rojas robbed Carmona and found Suarez, who slipped the ball to the Argentine, who made no mistake.\n\nThe eight-time Ballon d'Or winner then turned provider again as he split the New York defense with a brilliant through ball to Rojas, who deftly chipped over the advancing Carlos Coronel.\n\nSuarez's hat trick then came in the space of 12 minutes -- he first found the target when Messi chipped in a ball from the right and the Uruguayan hooked home a volley.\n\nIt was playground stuff minutes later when Suarez played a one-two with Messi and then poked home to make it 5-1.\n\nMessi was yet again the creator for Miami's sixth, which Suarez turned in from close range from the tightest of angles.\n\n\"The partnership of him (Messi) and Luis (Suarez) in the second half worked very well, like in old times (...) {"uri": "8111765378", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "02:11:03", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T02:11:03Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T02:10:07Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6941176652908325, "url": "https://wsvn.com/sports/inter-miami-cf/messi-scores-a-goal-and-has-5-assists-to-lead-inter-miami-to-a-6-2-rout-of-red-bulls/", "title": "Messi scores a goal and has 5 assists to lead Inter Miami to a 6-2 rout of Red Bulls - WSVN 7News | Miami News, Weather, Sports | Fort Lauderdale", "body": "FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla. (AP) -- Lionel Messi scored a goal and had five assists as Inter Miami trounced the New York Red Bulls 6-2 on Saturday night.\n\nMessi, who earned the MLS Player of the Month Award for April, has now scored and assisted in six consecutive league matches.\n\nLuis Su\u00e1rez had three goals and Matias Rojas scored twice as Inter Miami got six unanswered goals to come back from a 1-0 deficit at halftime. Messi and Su\u00e1rez now have a league-leading 10 goals each, helping keep Inter Miami (7-2-3, 24 points) atop the Eastern Conference.\n\nThe win extended Miami's unbeaten string to six. The streak began after a 4-0 loss at New York on April 20, in which Messi did not play because of an injury.\n\nMiami began the rout with Rojas' equalizer in the 48th minute. Messi centered a pass to Rojas whose left-footed shot landed under the crossbar.\n\nSu\u00e1rez then fed a charging Messi with a touch pass to beat New York goalkeeper Carlos Coronel with a shot from 15 yards.\n\nRojas made it 3-1 with his second goal in the 62nd minute on an assist from Messi.\n\nMessi then contributed on former Barcelona teammate Su\u00e1rez's first goal in the 69th minute.\n\nSu\u00e1rez also struck in the 75th and 81st minutes before the Red Bulls (4-2-5, 17 points) closed the scoring on Emil Forsberg's penalty kick in stoppage time.\n\nNew York controlled possession early and eventually capitalized on a Miami defensive breakdown that resulted on Dante Vanzeir's goal in the 30th minute. Jos\u00e9 Carmona ran deep into the right wing of the large area and blasted a shot that bounced off the far post. An unmarked Vanzeir retrieved the deflection and converted from 15 yards.\n\nMessi had his only scoring opportunity of the first half in the 24th minute, when Coronel stopped his shot from the edge of the penalty area.\n\nMessi's former Barcelona teammate Jordi Alba missed his third straight game because of a hamstring injury.\n\nBoth clubs will continue MLS play next Saturday. Inter Miami will visit CF Montreal while the Red Bulls will host New England.\n\nCopyright 2024 The Associated Press. All rights reserved. The Inter Miami CF forward was voted the Major League Soccer Player of the Month for April 2024.\n\nLionel Messi, back to his full fitness is again delivering for his side. Messi led Major League Soccer (MLS) with 10 goal contributions (six goals, four assists) during April in the MLS 2024 season. He did so in just four matches. For his mega performance, La Pulga was voted as the Player of the Month April 2024. This is Messi's first 'Player of the Month' award in MLS. Messi's six goals were the most in MLS while leading an Inter Miami squad that finished the month with a 3-0-1 record. Inter Miami scored a total of 12 goals in April, with Messi contributing to 10 of those. Messi becomes the second Miami player to be named MLS Player of the Month after Luis Su\u00e1rez earned the honour for February and March. {"uri": "8111770815", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "02:20:43", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T02:20:43Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T02:19:29Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.686274528503418, "url": "https://sports.yahoo.com/lionel-messi-smashes-mls-and-personal-records-with-goal-5-assists-in-a-single-half-021553146.html", "title": "Lionel Messi smashes MLS and personal records with goal, 5 assists in a single half", "body": "Lionel Messi has been tearing Major League Soccer to pieces, and with every passing game, his exploits become more magnificent, more comical, and, in a way, more ... mundane.\n\nHe is racking up goals and assists week after week, at silly rates, so silly that each successive game feels increasingly unfair and decreasingly notable.\n\nBut Messi's latest, Saturday in South Florida against the New York Red Bulls, was unlike any he or MLS had ever produced before.\n\nInter Miami trailed 1-0 at halftime. By the 81-minute mark, Messi had scored a goal and assisted five others.\n\nThe five assists were a single-game MLS record. The six goal contributions were a single-game MLS record. Both were also the most that Messi had registered in a single game throughout his glittering, unrivaled career.\n\nAnd he did it all in a single half -- in less than 34 minutes, to be precise.\n\nHis first assist was a relatively light lift. Inter Miami's newest signing, Mat\u00edas Rojas, took a Messi pass, beat a Red Bull, and picked out the top corner from\n\nBut his second assist was devilish:\n\nHis fourth was ridiculous, a testament to both his brilliance and the inferiority of his opponents.\n\nThe Red Bulls gifted him time and space throughout the second half. In the 75th minute, he beat an entire midfield line with a single cut, then played a one-two-three with Luis Suarez at the top of the box to create Suarez's second goal of the night.\n\nMessi also assisted Suarez's first, some eight minutes earlier.\n\nAnd roughly five minutes after the second, Suarez exploited an out-of-sync defensive line again. Messi found him, Suarez rounded a hapless goalkeeper, and Inter Miami extended its lead to 6-1.\n\nOh, and Messi had also scored a goal in amongst the five assists. He and Suarez pounced on a Red Bulls giveaway in the defensive third. Each only needed one touch.\n\nThe six goal contributions brought Messi to an absurd 22 on the season -- in seven-and-a-half MLS games. That's nearly three goal contributions per 90 minutes.\n\nHe is nearly halfway to both the single-season MLS assist record and the goal-plus-assist record -- in early May, and despite missing four games due to rest or injury.\n\nHe may not re-write every line in the league's record book, because he'll step away for a month beginning in June for the 2024 Copa Am\u00e9rica. But he is ripping up the league at rates never before seen.\n\nHe is also creating goals at unprecedented rates even for him, even at age 36 going on 37.\n\nMLS statisticians are generous with their awarding of assists, but even if you go by the global definition, Messi is now at 2.53 non-penalty goals plus assists per 90 minutes, on pace to shatter his personal single-season record of 1.80, set at Barcelona in La Liga in 2012-13.\n\nNeedless to say, he leads MLS in both goals and assists, despite missing those few games. Despite trailing 1-0 at halftime to a spirited goal by Dante Vanzeir, Inter Miami emerged from the break transformed, with Messi at the heart of an electrifying comeback.\n\nScoring once and assisting five times, Messi set two MLS records in one game: the most goal contributions in a single match with six, and the most assists in a single match with five. This was a performance that reverberated across the soccer world, showcasing not only his unmatchable skill but also his profound impact on his team and the league.\n\nSuarez, reaping the rewards of Messi's visionary play, completed a hat-trick, while newcomer Matias Rojas scored twice off the bench, marking his debut with the club in style. The game, which ended with Inter Miami at the top of theEastern Conference standings, was a testament to the team's depth and resilience, having now gained 17 of their 24 points from trailing positions.\n\nThe magnitude of the victory was not lost on the fans nor the pundits, as Messi was named Man of the Match in what could only be described as a masterclass of soccer intelligence and execution. His performance was a poignant reminder of why he remains one of the greatest, if not the greatest, to ever play the game.\n\nInter Miami's coach, reflecting on the historic win, praised the team's spirit and Messi's leadership. \"What we saw tonight was more than just a soccer game. It was a statement. Lionel doesn't just play; he inspires.\"\n\nAs the MLS season progresses, the eyes of the soccer world will remain fixed on Messi and Inter Miami, a team that now not only dreams of championship glory {"uri": "2024-05-343181680", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-02", "time": "19:17:27", "dateTime": "2024-05-02T19:17:27Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-02T19:08:00Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6823529601097107, "url": "https://www.miamiherald.com/sports/mls/inter-miami/article288247770.html", "title": "Messi voted MLS Player of the Month for April with six goals, four assists in four games", "body": "The Argentine Inter Miami star was voted the Major League Soccer Player of the Month for April.\n\nMessi led MLS with 10 goal contributions (six goals, four assists) in April, despite playing in just four matches. His six goals were a league-best and he led Inter Miami to the top of the Supporters' Shield standings with three victories, a tie, and no losses during the month.\n\nOf Miami's 12 goals in the month of April, Messi scored or assisted on 10 of those, which included the game-winning assist on April 20 and the game-winning goal on April 27.\n\nWith two goals and an assist in a 4-1 road win over the New England Revolution last Saturday, Messi became the first player in MLS history to record multiple goal contributions in five consecutive games.\n\nThe eight-time Ballon d'Or winner has nine goals and seven assists in his first seven games of the 2024 season, the most by a player in MLS history in his first seven games of a season and three more than the previous record holders Thierry Henry (13 in 2012) and Carlos Vela (13 in 2019).\n\nDespite his success and fame, Messi remains remarkably humble, said teammate Chelo Weigandt, an Argentine who joined the team last month.\n\n\"It's extraordinary to be his teammate,\" Weigandt said. \"Leo is very humble, very simple. What you see from a distance, that's how he is. He's a great person.\n\n\"He is very connected with the group, always talks to us. It's nice that such a global star pays attention to the young players in the club. He has taught me that you have to keep your feet on the ground. He is approachable. You can talk to him, ask for advice. At first, I was a little scared, shy to talk to him, but once you get to know him day to day, you realize how special he is because of his humility.\"\n\nMessi is the second Miami player to be named MLS Player of the Month after Luis Su\u00e1rez earned the honor for February and March. Inter Miami is the third club in MLS history to have two different players win first two Player of the Month honors to start a season, joining the LA Galaxy in 2004 (Carlos Ruiz and Alejandro Moreno) and the 2000 Kansas City Wizards (Miklos Molnar and Tony Meola).\n\nIn his career, Messi has earned 10 Player of the Month honors for his club - eight with FC Barcelona, one with Paris Saint-Germain, and one with Inter Miami.\n\nMiami will try to keep its five-game MLS unbeaten streak alive on Saturday at home against the New York Red Bulls, which beat Miami 4-0 on March 23.
